subcontent.text: UH at MÄnoa Kinesiology & Rehabilitation Science, Health & Physical Education Teacher | Hawaiâi Career Pathways Home Pathways & Programs Agriculture, Food, and Natural Resources Animal Systems (AS) Food Systems (FS) Agriculture and Food Production (AFP) Business Natural Resources Management (NRM) Architectural Design and Engineering Technology Architectural Design (AD) Engineering Building and Construction Mechanical, Electrical, and Plumbing (MEP) Systems Residential and Commercial (R & C) Construction Cultural Arts, Media, and Entertainment Digital Design (DD) Fashion and Artisan Design (FAD) Film and Media Production (FMP) Education Learning Support Professional (LSP) Teaching As a Profession (TAP) Health Services Public Health Services (PHS) Diagnostic Services (DS) Emergency Medical Services (EMS/EMT) Human Performance Therapeutic Services (HPTS) Nursing Services (NS) Hospitality, Tourism, and Recreation Culinary Arts (CA) Sustainable Hospitality and Tourism Management (SHTM) Information Technology and Digital Transformation Artificial Intelligence (AI) Programming Networking Cybersecurity (Cyber) Web Design and Development (WDD) Transportation Services Automotive Maintenance and Light Repair (MLR) Automotive Collision Repair (ACR) Aviation Maintenance Technology (AMT) Marine Maintenance Technology (MMT) Resources Contact Us UH MÄnoa Kinesiology & Rehabilitation Science Health & Physical Education Teacher Home Health KRS & HPETE Program Description: The Kinesiology & Rehabilitation Science Bachelor of Science degree in Health & Physical Education Teacher Education (HPETE) program is currently a member in good standing of the Association for Advancing Quality in Educator Preparation (AAQEP), with our next AAQEP full accreditation review scheduled for Spring 2021. The College was nationally accredited from 2001 to 2018 by NCATE, the National Council for Accreditation of Teacher Education. A professional preparation curriculum is provided for students who wish to be licensed to teach health and physical education in grades: K-6 (Elementary), 6-12 (Secondary) or K-12 health and physical education. This health and physical education program is for future professionals who are passionate about contributing to the growth, development, health, fitness and wellness, and lifelong physical activity of all individuals, but especially among youth. The student who majors in this program of study must demonstrate competence in motor skills and achieve and maintain health-related fitness. Additionally, future professionals will gain comprehensive knowledge relative to content in health and physical education including, effective teaching strategies, National and state standards, cultural competence, assessment, and accountability. While this program can lead to teacher licensure, before you can pursue courses for the licensure track, you must be admitted into the licensure track. Although you will leave with teacher certifications, this degree is also marketable to help you pursue a career in youth sport, fitness, and many other opportunities related to health and physical activity. subcontent.text: UH at Hilo Kinesiology & Exercise Science Program | Hawaiâi Career Pathways Home Pathways & Programs Agriculture, Food, and Natural Resources Animal Systems (AS) Food Systems (FS) Agriculture and Food Production (AFP) Business Natural Resources Management (NRM) Architectural Design and Engineering Technology Architectural Design (AD) Engineering Building and Construction Mechanical, Electrical, and Plumbing (MEP) Systems Residential and Commercial (R & C) Construction Cultural Arts, Media, and Entertainment Digital Design (DD) Fashion and Artisan Design (FAD) Film and Media Production (FMP) Education Learning Support Professional (LSP) Teaching As a Profession (TAP) Health Services Public Health Services (PHS) Diagnostic Services (DS) Emergency Medical Services (EMS/EMT) Human Performance Therapeutic Services (HPTS) Nursing Services (NS) Hospitality, Tourism, and Recreation Culinary Arts (CA) Sustainable Hospitality and Tourism Management (SHTM) Information Technology and Digital Transformation Artificial Intelligence (AI) Programming Networking Cybersecurity (Cyber) Web Design and Development (WDD) Transportation Services Automotive Maintenance and Light Repair (MLR) Automotive Collision Repair (ACR) Aviation Maintenance Technology (AMT) Marine Maintenance Technology (MMT) Resources Contact Us Kinesiology & Exercise Science Program Home Health Services Kinesiology & Exercise Science Program Description: Kinesiology and Exercise Sciences (KES) is one of the largest, fastest growing programs at the University of HawaiÊ»i at Hilo, and encompasses a wide range of disciplines including fields of movement sciences, anatomy, physiology, exercise physiology and the exercise sciences, sport psychology, motor learning, athletic training, physical therapy, health promotion, physical education, and coaching. The KES major is comprised of a three-track system: Allied Health Track: Designed for students who have interests in advanced study (graduate or professional school) in physical therapy, medicine or other allied health fields. Applied Kinesiology and Exercise Science track: Designed for students who have interests in careers such as Fitness Program Director, Personal Trainer, Fitness Instructor, Strength Coach, and more. Health promotion track: Designed for students who have interests in careers such as Health Educator, Health Coach, Wellness Prevention Program Manager, Health Researcher, and much more. subcontent.text: UH at MÄnoa Human Development and Family Studies Program | Hawaiâi Career Pathways Home Pathways & Programs Agriculture, Food, and Natural Resources Animal Systems (AS) Food Systems (FS) Agriculture and Food Production (AFP) Business Natural Resources Management (NRM) Architectural Design and Engineering Technology Architectural Design (AD) Engineering Building and Construction Mechanical, Electrical, and Plumbing (MEP) Systems Residential and Commercial (R & C) Construction Cultural Arts, Media, and Entertainment Digital Design (DD) Fashion and Artisan Design (FAD) Film and Media Production (FMP) Education Learning Support Professional (LSP) Teaching As a Profession (TAP) Health Services Public Health Services (PHS) Diagnostic Services (DS) Emergency Medical Services (EMS/EMT) Human Performance Therapeutic Services (HPTS) Nursing Services (NS) Hospitality, Tourism, and Recreation Culinary Arts (CA) Sustainable Hospitality and Tourism Management (SHTM) Information Technology and Digital Transformation Artificial Intelligence (AI) Programming Networking Cybersecurity (Cyber) Web Design and Development (WDD) Transportation Services Automotive Maintenance and Light Repair (MLR) Automotive Collision Repair (ACR) Aviation Maintenance Technology (AMT) Marine Maintenance Technology (MMT) Resources Contact Us UH MÄnoa Human Development and Family Studies Home Health Public Health HDFS Program Description: Human Development and Family Studies (HDFS) is a Bachelorâs of Science degree program that provides students with a comprehensive, ecological systems-based program of study in human development, family development, and family resource management. The HDFS curriculum provides students with a multitude of experiences through coursework and off-campus activities to give them the knowledge and professional skills needed for careers in family/human services. The curriculum encompasses these studies: Changing needs, dynamics, and challenges of families over time Management of human, material, financial, and community resources to meet these needs Growth and development of individuals over the human life cycle Interrelationships of individuals, families, and communities in the context of diverse socioeconomic and cultural systems. The HDFS curriculum provides students with comprehensive study of human development, family development, and family resource management. Students are prepared for positions in family service agencies; family life and parenting education programs; children's, youth, and gerontology programs; child care and early childhood education centers; and consumer affairs agencies. The courses cover these topics and more: Healthy family relationships Healthy and resilient human development at all ages Family caregiving for older adults and grandparents raising children Family public policy Family and consumer resource management Community leadership and resource development. title: Nursing | Hawaiâi Career Pathways
text: Nursing | Hawaiâi Career Pathways Home Pathways & Programs Agriculture, Food, and Natural Resources Animal Systems (AS) Food Systems (FS) Agriculture and Food Production (AFP) Business Natural Resources Management (NRM) Architectural Design and Engineering Technology Architectural Design (AD) Engineering Building and Construction Mechanical, Electrical, and Plumbing (MEP) Systems Residential and Commercial (R & C) Construction Cultural Arts, Media, and Entertainment Digital Design (DD) Fashion and Artisan Design (FAD) Film and Media Production (FMP) Education Learning Support Professional (LSP) Teaching As a Profession (TAP) Health Services Public Health Services (PHS) Diagnostic Services (DS) Emergency Medical Services (EMS/EMT) Human Performance Therapeutic Services (HPTS) Nursing Services (NS) Hospitality, Tourism, and Recreation Culinary Arts (CA) Sustainable Hospitality and Tourism Management (SHTM) Information Technology and Digital Transformation Artificial Intelligence (AI) Programming Networking Cybersecurity (Cyber) Web Design and Development (WDD) Transportation Services Automotive Maintenance and Light Repair (MLR) Automotive Collision Repair (ACR) Aviation Maintenance Technology (AMT) Marine Maintenance Technology (MMT) Resources Contact Us Nursing Program Home Pathways and Programs Health Nursing Nursing Pathway Map to Employment Nursing is a profession within the healthcare sector focused on providing care, support, and assistance to individuals, families, and communities to promote and maintain their overall health and well-being. Nurses play a crucial role in various healthcare settings, including hospitals, clinics, nursing homes, schools, home care, and more. Nursing is a rewarding profession that requires compassion, critical thinking, communication skills, and a commitment to improving the lives of patients and their communities. To pursue a career in the nursing field, individuals need to complete nursing education or training programs, which can range from certification programs to associate's, bachelor's, or even master's degrees in nursing. Students in the nursing program of study in high school will have the opportunity to lay the foundation for their journey into nursing with a clear understanding of the role and responsibilities as well as work based learning opportunities. The map below shows various education and training pathway opportunities available in HawaiÊ»i, starting high school and leading you to a job here in HawaiÊ»i. The Breakdown of the Map Starting in a Nursing program of study in high school you will be introduced to key concepts, overall understanding of the field and the opportunity to explore nursing through work based learning to ensure nursing is the right fit for you. A career in nursing will require additional training and certification depending on the level of nursing a student wants to pursue. While more training is required, students are able to attain entry level certifications that will allow you to work in the field right after high school. Community College Track (2+ Years) University Track (4+ Years) Training Programs (< 1-Year) How to use the map. The guided navigation view will take the user through a step-by-step process that takes you through various screens that focus on selected areas of the map. subcontent.title: Nursing Entry Level Jobs - Training Programs | Hawaiâi Career Pathways
subcontent.text: Nursing Entry Level Jobs - Training Programs | Hawaiâi Career Pathways Home Pathways & Programs Agriculture, Food, and Natural Resources Animal Systems (AS) Food Systems (FS) Agriculture and Food Production (AFP) Business Natural Resources Management (NRM) Architectural Design and Engineering Technology Architectural Design (AD) Engineering Building and Construction Mechanical, Electrical, and Plumbing (MEP) Systems Residential and Commercial Construction (RCC) Cultural Arts, Media, and Entertainment Digital Design (DD) Fashion and Artisan Design (FAD) Film and Media Entertainment (FME) Education Learning Support Professional (LSP) Teaching As a Profession (TAP) Health Services Public Health Services (PHS) Diagnostic Services (DS) Emergency Medical Services (EMS/EMT) Human Performance Therapeutic Services (HPTS) Nursing Services (NS) Hospitality, Tourism, and Recreation Culinary Arts (CA) Sustainable Hospitality and Tourism Management (SHTM) Information Technology and Digital Transformation Artificial Intelligence (AI) Programming Networking Cybersecurity (Cyber) Web Design and Development (WDD) Transportation Services Automotive Maintenance and Light Repair (MLR) Automotive Collision Repair (ACR) Aviation Maintenance Technology (AMT) Marine Maintenance Technology (MMT) Resources Contact Us Nursing Entry Level Jobs/ Training Programs Home Pathways & Programs Entry Level Jobs-Training Programs See a current list of FREE post high school training programs currently available through the University of Hawaiâi Community Colleges. Take a look at Good Jobs Hawaiâi There are several benefits to obtaining entry-level training programs or certifications before starting nursing school. Some of those certifications can be done while you are in high school or shortly after graduation. Here are a few reasons why obtaining one or more of theses certifications would help you on your path to become registered nurse: Enhanced Knowledge and Skills: Entry-level certifications provide you with foundational knowledge and skills related to healthcare and patient care. This can give you a head start in understanding basic concepts and procedures, making it easier to grasp more advanced nursing concepts during your studies. Competitive Advantage: Nursing programs are competitive, with limited spots available. Having entry-level certifications can set you apart from other applicants by demonstrating your commitment to the healthcare field and your readiness to contribute to patient care. It shows that you have taken the initiative to acquire relevant skills and experience, making you a more attractive candidate. Practical Experience: Entry-level certifications can provide you with exposure to real healthcare settings, allowing you to become familiar with the clinical environment, patient interactions, and healthcare team dynamics. This can help ease the transition from classroom learning to clinical practice during nursing school. Networking Opportunities: Obtaining entry-level certifications can help you build connections with healthcare professionals, instructors, and potential employers. Networking within the healthcare field will allow you to have a greater understanding of careers in healthcare through these connections. Improved Employability: Possessing entry-level certification can make you more competitive in the job market and increase your chances of finding employment as a nurse. Many healthcare facilities value nurses with diverse skills, such as phlebotomy, as it allows for flexibility and versatility in patient care settings. Entry Level Training Programs: Entry-level training for nursing-related careers can vary depending on the specific role and level of education required. Here are some common entry-level training options for nursing-related careers: Basic Life Support (BLS) Certification: High school students can pursue BLS certification, which teaches cardiopulmonary resuscitation (CPR) and automated external defibrillator (AED) skills. BLS certification is often required for healthcare professionals, including nurses. Range of Program duration: 2-4 hours Phlebotomy certification: Involves the collection of blood samples for laboratory testing or medical purposes. By successfully completing a phlebotomy training program from an accredited institution, which includes classroom instruction on topics like anatomy and physiology, venipuncture techniques, infection control, medical terminology, and legal and ethical considerations, students can obtain certification by a recognized certifying agency. Range of program duration: 100-150 hours Certified Nursing Assistant (CNA) Training: This is a short-term training program that typically lasts a few weeks to a few months. CNAs provide basic patient care, such as assisting with daily activities, taking vital signs, and helping with hygiene. Training programs are often offered at vocational schools, community colleges, or healthcare facilities, and typically include both classroom instruction and clinical practice. Range of program duration: 100-200 hours Certified Nursing Assistant (CNA) II: Patient Care Technician Training: After you become a CNA, you can further your education and expand your employability through this advanced training program. This course is designed to educate and train certified nursing assistants to support licensed nursing staff in long term care facilities and hospitals. Participants will, through lecture, laboratory practice and evaluation, specialize in skills to include sterile gloving, wound care, oral suctioning, diabetes care, enteral nutrition, catheterization, colostomy care, specimen collection and tracheostomy care. Range of program duration: 100-200 hours Licensed Practical Nurse (LPN) Program: LPN training programs are typically one year in duration and are offered at community colleges, or hospitals. LPNs provide basic nursing care, including administering medications, monitoring patients' condition, and assisting with procedures. These programs usually include both classroom and clinical components. Range of program duration: See KapÊ»iolani Community College LPN program or UH Maui College CNA to LPN Bridge program Theses training programs can lead to the following Jobs: Certified Nursing Assistant Phlebotomist Caregivers Home Health Aide Assisted living Certified Nursing Assistant Patient Care Technician Dialysis Patient Care Technician Bridging the Gap Students need to learn the right skills today to succeed in the jobs of tomorrow. subcontent.text: Maui College Nursing Program | Hawaiâi Career Pathways Home Pathways & Programs Agriculture, Food, and Natural Resources Animal Systems (AS) Food Systems (FS) Agriculture and Food Production (AFP) Business Natural Resources Management (NRM) Architectural Design and Engineering Technology Architectural Design (AD) Engineering Building and Construction Mechanical, Electrical, and Plumbing (MEP) Systems Residential and Commercial (R & C) Construction Cultural Arts, Media, and Entertainment Digital Design (DD) Fashion and Artisan Design (FAD) Film and Media Production (FMP) Education Learning Support Professional (LSP) Teaching As a Profession (TAP) Health Services Public Health Services (PHS) Diagnostic Services (DS) Emergency Medical Services (EMS/EMT) Human Performance Therapeutic Services (HPTS) Nursing Services (NS) Hospitality, Tourism, and Recreation Culinary Arts (CA) Sustainable Hospitality and Tourism Management (SHTM) Information Technology and Digital Transformation Artificial Intelligence (AI) Programming Networking Cybersecurity (Cyber) Web Design and Development (WDD) Transportation Services Automotive Maintenance and Light Repair (MLR) Automotive Collision Repair (ACR) Aviation Maintenance Technology (AMT) Marine Maintenance Technology (MMT) Resources Contact Us Nursing Program Home Health Services Nursing Program Description: UHMC Nursing Program faculty embrace the mission of Maui College. The faculty aim to inspire and support students in the pursuit of nursing education and life-long learning. We prepare students to recognize the trends in health care delivery, respond to the increased complexity of clinical environments, and adapt to economic changes. We believe that the learning process is enhanced when the student is self-directed, and support the student to take responsibility for their own learning when challenged with academic rigor. The UHMC Nursing Program coursework builds on basic liberal arts, behavioral and natural sciences, and includes bioethical issues, application of technology, cultural awareness, and evidence-based practice. As a member of the Hawaii Statewide Nursing Consortium, the career ladder program supports students to achieve a Certificate of Achievement and LPN licensure at the end of the first year, an Associate of Science degree and RN licensure at the end of the second year, and, if the student chooses, to continue on for a Bachelor of Science degree from UH Manoa with the addition of a third year. MC nursing graduates are expected to abide by the laws of the state in which they practice, the American Nurses Association Standards of Practice, and the American Nurses Association Code of Ethics. Apply Now Program Counselors Wayne Aguiran Program Counselor (808) 984-3306 uhmc.advising@hawaii.edu Program Prerequisites: University of HawaiÊ»i Maui Collegeâs Nursing program has select admissions, meaning you must complete the following before you apply to enter the nursing program: Apply to UH Maui College Meet with the UH Maui College counselors to let them know that you want to be in the Nursing program (uhmc.advising@hawaii.edu). They will advise you on what you need to complete in order to apply for the ASN. Take the TEAS (Test of Essential Academic Skills) Exam. You will need to declare a major while you are working on your pre-nursing courses, declaring Liberal Arts as your major will allow you to still receive financial aid if you apply and quality. You will not declare your major as Nursing UNTIL you are accepted into the Nursing program. Register for courses on the Nursing program prerequisite course list. Pass each class with a âCâ or better, âC-â is not accepted! Complete all of the prerequisite courses with a minimum GPA of 2.5. Take the TEAS (Test of Essential Academic Skills) Exam. Get a minimum of %58.7 adjusted individual total score. Make sure you have completed all the necessary prerequisites to apply for the Nursing programÊ»s Associates of Science in Nursing degree, then submit your application to the UH Maui College Nursing program! Cost and time commitment: Cost per credit: $131 Additional Nursing program costs: Up to $500 per semester Total number of credits: 73 Approximate total program tuition costs: ~$12,670 Estimated program length: (based on full time student status) Program Prerequisite courses: 1 year Nursing Program: 2.5 years Financial Aid Resources Recommended College Courses during High School: The courses listed below are recommended for high school students who are interested in the UH Maui College Nursing program and can be completed through a dual credit program such as Early College when in high school. These courses meet degree pre-program requirements for the UH Maui College Nursing program. Nursing program Prerequisite Courses: ENG 100 Composition I *Prerequisite - ENG 22 OR placement into ENG 100 MATH 100: Survey of Mathematics *Prerequisite - âCâ or better in MATH 75X, OR placement into MATH 100 AND ENG 22 or placement into ENG 100 PSY 100: Survey of Psychology *Prerequisite - âCâ or better in ENG 22 OR placement into ENG 100 HWST 107: HawaiÊ»i: Center of the Pacific *Prerequisite - âCâ or better in ENG 22 OR placement into ENG 100 MICRO 130: General Microbiology *Prerequisite - âCâ or better in MATH 82 OR placement into MATH 100 AND placement into ENG 100 HDFS 230: Human Development *Prerequisite - ENG 22 or higher *Prerequisites are courses or other background that must be completed PRIOR to enrollment. The program admits new students every fall semester. The first year of the curriculum requires three semesters (Fall, Spring and Summer 6 weeks session). Successful completion of the first year of the curriculum leads to a Certificate of Achievement (CA) and eligibility to take the National Council Licensure Examination (NCLEXÂ®) exam for licensure as a Practical Nurse. Continuation into the second year of the Career Ladder Nursing program is based upon satisfactorily meeting established criteria for continuing students. The second year requires an additional two semesters, leading to an Associate in Science (AS) Degree and eligibility to take the NCLEXÂ® examination for licensure as a Registered Nurse. Graduates are eligible for admission to the fourth year of the Bachelor of Science in Nursing program at UH MÄnoa. Additional prerequisite courses may be necessary to take to satisfy the General Education requirements at UHM. Licensed Practical Nurses (LPNs) seeking advanced standing into the second level of the Career Ladder Nursing program must meet established criteria for entry of LPNs into the second level. Apply Now Contact Program Counselor Shelley R. Sutter Program Counselor (808) 245-8257 shelley3@hawaii.edu Program Prerequisites: KauaÊ»i Community Collegeâs Nursing program has select admissions , meaning you must complete the following before you apply to enter the nursing program: Apply to KauaÊ»i Community College Meet with a counselor and let them know that you want to be in the Nursing program. They will help you along the way. Register for courses on the Nursing program prerequisite course list. Pass each class with a âCâ or better, âC-â is not accepted! Complete all of the prerequisite courses with a minimum GPA of 2.75. Take the TEAS (Test of Essential Academic Skills) Exam. Get at least %58.7 proficiency in all categories. The Nursing Program Admissions Committee will utilize an admissions rubric approved by the Nursing program faculty as the basis for admission into the Nursing program. Prospective students should see the Health Science counselor for the current admissions rubric. subcontent.text: Hawaiâi Community College Nursing Program | Hawaiâi Career Pathways Home Pathways & Programs Agriculture, Food, and Natural Resources Animal Systems (AS) Food Systems (FS) Agriculture and Food Production (AFP) Business Natural Resources Management (NRM) Architectural Design and Engineering Technology Architectural Design (AD) Engineering Building and Construction Mechanical, Electrical, and Plumbing (MEP) Systems Residential and Commercial (R & C) Construction Cultural Arts, Media, and Entertainment Digital Design (DD) Fashion and Artisan Design (FAD) Film and Media Production (FMP) Education Learning Support Professional (LSP) Teaching As a Profession (TAP) Health Services Public Health Services (PHS) Diagnostic Services (DS) Emergency Medical Services (EMS/EMT) Human Performance Therapeutic Services (HPTS) Nursing Services (NS) Hospitality, Tourism, and Recreation Culinary Arts (CA) Sustainable Hospitality and Tourism Management (SHTM) Information Technology and Digital Transformation Artificial Intelligence (AI) Programming Networking Cybersecurity (Cyber) Web Design and Development (WDD) Transportation Services Automotive Maintenance and Light Repair (MLR) Automotive Collision Repair (ACR) Aviation Maintenance Technology (AMT) Marine Maintenance Technology (MMT) Resources Contact Us Nursing Program Home Health Services Nursing Program Description: The Associate in Science Degree in Nursing program provides students with a scientific foundation for entry level clinical practice as a Registered Nurse (RN) in hospitals, long-term care facilities, and community based settings. Upon completion of the program, graduates are eligible to take the National Council Licensure Exam for Registered Nursing (NCLEX-RN). RNâs provide and coordinate patient care, educate patients and the public about various health conditions, and provide advice and emotional support to patients and their family members. The HawaiÊ»i Community CollegeÊ»s Associate in Science Degree in Nursing program has two pathways: Generic pathway (AS-NURS): 27 credits of non-nursing prerequisite and general education courses and four semesters of coursework in nursing (46 credits) for a total of 73 credits. ON HOLD FOR FALL 23 - SPRING 24 LPN to AS-NURS pathway: For students who (1) possession of a current HI Practical Nurse License; and have (2) minimum 1 year experience working as LPN; and (3) Completion of all non-nursing prerequisite and general education courses for the AS-NURS program. Includes 27 credits of non-nursing prerequisite and general education courses, credit given for advanced placement (21) and one summer session and two semesters of coursework in nursing (25 credits) for a total of 73 credits. Apply Now Contact Program Chair Dr. Luzivminda Miguel Program Chair (808) 934-2545 miguellb@hawaii.edu Program Prerequisites: HawaiÊ»i Community Collegeâs Nursing program has select admissions, meaning you must complete the following before you apply to enter the nursing program: Apply to HawaiÊ»i Community College Meet with the HawaiÊ»i Community College counselors to let them know that you want to be in the Nursing program. They will advise you on what you need to complete prior to applying for the AS-NURS. Declaring a Major. You will need to declare a major while you are working on your pre-nursing courses, declaring Liberal Arts as your major will allow you to still receive financial aid if you apply and quality. You will not declare your major as Nursing UNTIL you are accepted into the Nursing program. Register for courses on the Nursing program prerequisite course list. Pass each class with a âCâ or better, âC-â is not accepted! Complete all of the prerequisite courses with a minimum GPA of 2.5. Take the TEAS (Test of Essential Academic Skills) Exam. Individual adjusted score must be at the Proficient Level (Minimum score of 58.7%) or higher. Submit the Intent to Apply to Nursing Program Form and other required Nursing admissions documents as listed on the Application Checklist by deadline. The Intent to Apply form and Application Checklist can be found online at https://hawaii.hawaii.edu/nursing/apply . Submit with your application materials a completed point allocation worksheet found at https://hawaii.hawaii.edu/nursing/apply . All applicants who meet eligibility requirements will be reviewed and ranked according to the criteria outlined on the Admission Criteria Worksheet. All available seats will be offered to applicants with the highest-ranking score using the Admission Criteria Worksheet. Priority will be given to those who have established Hawaiâi residency. subcontent.text: UH West Oâahu Pre-Nursing | Hawaiâi Career Pathways Home Pathways & Programs Agriculture, Food, and Natural Resources Animal Systems (AS) Food Systems (FS) Agriculture and Food Production (AFP) Business Natural Resources Management (NRM) Architectural Design and Engineering Technology Architectural Design (AD) Engineering Building and Construction Mechanical, Electrical, and Plumbing (MEP) Systems Residential and Commercial (R & C) Construction Cultural Arts, Media, and Entertainment Digital Design (DD) Fashion and Artisan Design (FAD) Film and Media Production (FMP) Education Learning Support Professional (LSP) Teaching As a Profession (TAP) Health Services Public Health Services (PHS) Diagnostic Services (DS) Emergency Medical Services (EMS/EMT) Human Performance Therapeutic Services (HPTS) Nursing Services (NS) Hospitality, Tourism, and Recreation Culinary Arts (CA) Sustainable Hospitality and Tourism Management (SHTM) Information Technology and Digital Transformation Artificial Intelligence (AI) Programming Networking Cybersecurity (Cyber) Web Design and Development (WDD) Transportation Services Automotive Maintenance and Light Repair (MLR) Automotive Collision Repair (ACR) Aviation Maintenance Technology (AMT) Marine Maintenance Technology (MMT) Resources Contact Us Pre-Nursing Home Health Services Pre-Nursing Program Description: Through a unique collaboration between UH West OÊ»ahu and the Nancy Atmospera-Walch School of Nursing at UH MÄnoa, Pre-Nursing Pathway students will enroll in rigorous science courses and engage in hands-on clinical training opportunities in a variety of settings led by highly skilled professionals. This dynamic academic experience will be supplemented with state-of-the-art simulation equipment that provides extended learning options. The program fosters a holistic approach through incorporating Native Hawaiian values and principles, as well as place-based and aina-based learning. The pre-Nursing Pathway enables UH West OÊ»ahu students to complete all general education, prerequisite, and Nursing degree coursework for a UH MÄnoaâs Bachelor of Science in Nursing on UH West OÊ»ahuâs campus. Apply Now Program Contact Program Contact (808) 689-2480 uhwonurs@hawaii.edu Program Prerequisites: Students will apply for admission to UH West OÊ»ahu as âPre-Nursing Pathwayâ students in the Bachelors of Applied Science - Health Professionals, General Health Science concentration. Once accepted, students will enroll in and complete pre-nursing courses. Students are eligible to apply to the BS in Nursing program offered through the Nancy Atmospera-Walch School of Nursing at UH MÄnoa after successful completion of the Pre-Nursing Pathway courses. Through this specialized partnership, both campuses will provide students with support services and opportunities needed to prepare for admission into the Nursing program. Admission to the UH MÄnoa Bachelor of Science in Nursing is highly selective; students preparing for entry into the UH West OÊ»ahu and UH MÄnoa BS in Nursing Partnership are encouraged to meet with a College Success Advisor from the UH West OÊ»ahu campus. The UH Manoa Bachelor of Science in Nursing has four different pathways depending you each students education background and circumstances: High School Direct Entry in Nursing For High School Graduates from the Class of 2024 Fall (August) Admission only This full-time cohort program admits high school graduates who will complete their Bachelor of Science in nursing degree in four years. With direct entry into our nursing program, a studentâs academic path is secure. Traditional Bachelor of Science in Nursing For Current UH Manoa, Pre-Nursing, Transfer, and Veteran Students Fall (August) Admission only This full-time program admits current UH Manoa, Pre-Nursing, transfer, and veteran students. Secondary priority will be given to UH West Oahu students that meet criteria, and thereafter to UH Manoa Pre-Nursing students that reside in Leeward Oahu. Online RN to Bachelor of Science in Nursing (ASN/RN to BSN) For Associate Degree in Nursing and Diploma Graduates Fall (August) and Spring (January) Admission This part-time and full-time online, on-demand program admits ADN and diploma graduates. The program builds upon their current nursing degree with coursework to enhance professional development and achieve a BS degree. This educational experience encourages student-faculty interactions and offers hands-on learning and leadership opportunities. The Nursing Program emphasizes life long learning and teaches students to deliver culturally congruent nursing care in a rural environment. The Bachelor of science in Nursing program at the University of Hawaii at Hilo (UHH) School of Nursing (SON) meets the state education requirements for a Registered Nurse license in the state of Hawaii. The UHH SON has not determined if the Bachelor of Science in Nursing program meets the state education requirements in any other state, any U.S. Territory, or the District of Columbia. UH Hilo ASN/RN to BSN Program The RN to BSN Program supports the mission of the University of HawaiÊ»i at Hilo in providing a learning environment that is responsive to the needs of a diverse student population and that stresses rigorous high quality education in a caring, personalized atmosphere. New students are admitted each semester and are given both theoretical instruction and an opportunity for clinical application of nursing skills as they prepare for entry-level practice as registered nurses. After graduates have passed the nursing licensure examination, they will be prepared to fill beginning level positions as Registered Nurses in hospitals, doctorâs offices, or other health-related institutions, and participate in the planning, implementation and evaluation of nursing care. subcontent.title: Admission Requirements | Hawaiâi Career Pathways
subcontent.text: Admission Requirements | Hawaiâi Career Pathways Home Pathways & Programs Agriculture, Food, and Natural Resources Animal Systems (AS) Food Systems (FS) Agriculture and Food Production (AFP) Business Natural Resources Management (NRM) Architectural Design and Engineering Technology Architectural Design (AD) Engineering Building and Construction Mechanical, Electrical, and Plumbing (MEP) Systems Residential and Commercial Construction (RCC) Cultural Arts, Media, and Entertainment Digital Design (DD) Fashion and Artisan Design (FAD) Film and Media Entertainment (FME) Education Learning Support Professional (LSP) Teaching As a Profession (TAP) Health Services Public Health Services (PHS) Diagnostic Services (DS) Emergency Medical Services (EMS/EMT) Human Performance Therapeutic Services (HPTS) Nursing Services (NS) Hospitality, Tourism, and Recreation Culinary Arts (CA) Sustainable Hospitality and Tourism Management (SHTM) Information Technology and Digital Transformation Artificial Intelligence (AI) Programming Networking Cybersecurity (Cyber) Web Design and Development (WDD) Transportation Services Automotive Maintenance and Light Repair (MLR) Automotive Collision Repair (ACR) Aviation Maintenance Technology (AMT) Marine Maintenance Technology (MMT) Resources Contact Us Nursing Admission Requirements Home Pathways & Programs Admission Requirements Post-secondary (college) Nursing programs in HawaiÊ»i have what is called Selected Admission:  Selected admissions nursing programs are competitive programs that only admit a limited number of students. These programs have a rigorous application process, and only highly qualified candidates are accepted.  Applying to these programs happens AFTER you are admitted to the college or university of your choice and have completed the basic prerequisites for that campus nursing program. The basic admissions requirements are: Course prerequisites: Selected admissions nursing programs have specific prerequisite coursework that must be completed before applying. These prerequisites usually include biology, chemistry, anatomy, and physiology courses and may vary campus. GPA and Testing requirements: Nursing programs have minimum GPA requirements that applicants must meet with all prerequisite courses. These requirements can vary per campus. The Test of Essential Academic Skills (TEAS) is a requirement for nursing program admission. Minimum score required will vary by campus. Application process: All applicants who meet eligibility requirements will be reviewed and ranked according to the criteria outlined by each campus. All available seats will be offered to applicants with the highest-ranking scores. Internship or work experience: Some selected admissions nursing programs also prioritize applicants with relevant internships or work experience in a health care setting. For specific prerequisite courses, test scores and admissions requirements, select the campus via our career maps. UH Community Colleges To apply for admission to a UH Community College with the intent to later apply for the nursing program you must: Be 18 years of age or older, or Have earned a U.S. high school diploma, GED, or equivalency certificate *Please see individual community college websites for course placement information The following UH Community College campuses have associates degree programs in Nursing: KauaÊ»i Community College Kapiolani Community College UH Maui College HawaiÊ»i Community College * University of HawaiÊ»i at Manoa * University of HawaiÊ»i Hilo * University of HawaiÊ»i West Oahu For general admission to these UH university campuses with the intent to later apply for their Bachelors of Science in Nursing programs, you must: Know and provide your current high school GPA Have taken the following high school course requirements: 4 units of English (*journalism and/or newswriting do not count as English credits) 3 units of Math (including Algebra I, Algebra II, and Geometry) 3 units of Science (laboratory courses recommended) 3 units of Social Studies 4 units of other college-prep courses at UHM/UHWO or 7 units of other college-prep courses at UH Hilo College-prep courses can include a 4th unit of math, science, or social science. High school foreign language courses count toward other college-prep courses, but is not required . Certain programs (e.g., nursing, social work, education, etc.) may have additional requirements. Please check with the appropriate department for more information. 5 units of electives (Examples of elective courses: Art, Dance, Band, Physical Education, AVID, Computer Science, etc.) If available, SAT or ACT scores (optional) Other supplemental documents (might be required for individual programs) Letter(s) of Recommendation Personal Statement & List of Achievements form For campus specific requirements, please see individual campus pages via our career map * Chaminade University of Honolulu Cumulative high school GPA of 2.50 or higher High school students in dual enrollment or running start programs will need to submit official college transcripts Provide a written statement describing your interest in pursuing your degree at Chaminade University of Honolulu, and any related extracurricular activities that have prepared you for your educational goals.  This statement must be a minimum of 250 words. Test Scores (Optional) For Nursing program requirements * HawaiÊ»i Pacific University HPU understands that each student has a unique academic history and individual talents. This is why HPU takes a holistic approach to reviewing applications, and considers all the information provided on your application to make an admissions decision.  For more admissions information, please visit the HPU Admissions website . What is CONSIDERED: Grade Point Average - GP SAT and/or ACT scores (or English Proficiency if educated outside of the US Extracurricular activitie Personal statement (essay) and/or resum Academic area of interest Bridging the Gap Students need to learn the right skills today to succeed in the jobs of tomorrow. The program consists of planned learning experiences in classroom, laboratory and faculty-supervised clinical settings which will prepare the student to function in the role of a beginning practitioner of practical nursing. The program prepares the student for eligibility to take the licensure examination for practical nurses. Upon satisfactory completion of the program, students are eligible to take the licensing examination to become a Licensed Practical Nurse. The program is fully accredited by the Board of Nursing, State of HawaiÊ»i. The Practical Nursing Program prepares graduates for the National Council of Licensure Examination for practical nurses (NCLEX-PN). Meet with the program counselors again to make sure you have completed all the necessary prerequisites to apply for the PRCN program! The program consists of planned learning experiences in classroom, laboratory and faculty-supervised clinical settings which will prepare the student to function in the role of a beginning practitioner of practical nursing. The program prepares the student for eligibility to take the licensure examination for practical nurses. Upon satisfactory completion of the program, students are eligible to take the licensing examination to become a Licensed Practical Nurse. The program is fully accredited by the Board of Nursing, State of HawaiÊ»i. The Practical Nursing Program prepares graduates for the National Council of Licensure Examination for practical nurses (NCLEX-PN). Apply Now Program Counselors Crystalyn Hottenstein and Kristy Yoshikawa Program Counselors (808) 734-9305 kapnurs@hawaii.edu Program Prerequisites: Hawaiâi state practical nursing license is required in order to be considered for the Transition for Licensed Practical Nurses Program. See KapiÊ»olani Community College PRCN program for more details on becoming a Licensed Practical Nurse. Cost and time commitment: Cost per credit: $131 Additional Nursing program costs: Up to $500 per semester Total number of credits: 70-71 Approximate total program tuition costs: $9,170 - $12,670 Estimated program length: (based on full time student status) Program Prerequisite courses: 1.5 year Nursing Program: 2 years Financial Aid Resources Recommended College Courses during High School: The courses listed below are recommended for high school students who are interested in the KapiÊ»olani Community College LPN-RN program and can be completed through a dual credit program such as Early College when in high school. These courses meet degree pre-program requirements for the KapiÊ»olani Community College LPN-RN program. KapiÊ»olani Community College Nursing program prerequisite courses: ENG 100: Composition I *Prerequisite - Placement into ENG 100 MATH 100: College Algebra *Prerequisite - âCâ or better in MATH 75X, OR placement into MATH 100 HDFS 230: Human Development *Prerequisite - None *Prerequisites are courses or other background that must be completed PRIOR to enrollment. Prerequisites are REQUIRED for registration. Please contact program coordinator or advisor for information on placement into courses as there are multiple methods of placement per campus. Through a partnership with Hale Makua, Ê»Ohana Pacific Health, and Kaiser, eligible Maui and OÊ»ahu, healthcare professionals have an opportunity to become Practical Nurses (PN) while they are working. If your goal is to work as a PN, this program offers you that pathway! PN graduates are prepared to work under the supervision of a registered nurse or physician in hospitals, extended care facilities, private nursing agencies, home health agencies, clinics, and physician offices. Apply Now Pre-Nursing Program Counselors Darlene Guerrero Pre-Nursing Program Counselors (808) 984-3306 uhmc.advising@hawaii.edu Program Prerequisites: UH Maui Collegeâs CNA to LPN Bridge program has select admissions, meaning you must complete the following before you apply to enter the program: Apply to UH Maui College Complete program prerequisite courses with a âCâ or better Take the TEAS (Test of Essential Academic Skills) Exam. Get at least %57 adjusted individual total score. Meet with the Program counselors to make sure you have completed all the necessary prerequisites to apply for the CNA to PN Bridge program. Cost and time commitment: Cost per credit: $131 Additional Nursing program costs: ~$3,653 Total number of credits: 46 Approximate total program tuition costs: ~$9,679 Estimated program length: (based on full time student status, 12+ credits) Program Prerequisite courses: 0.5 - 1 year Nursing Program: 1.5 years Financial Aid Resources Recommended College Courses during High School: The courses listed below are recommended for high school students to complete through a dual credit program such as Early College when in high school. These courses meet degree pre-program requirements for the KauaÊ»i Community College Nursing program. 			    and Recreation (HOST) Pathway Home Pathways and Programs Hospitality, Tourism, and Recreation Culinary Arts (CULN) The Culinary Arts program is designed to provide students with advanced level professional chef and related cooking skills and techniques for restaurants and other commercial food establishments. Students will learn advanced techniques in culinary skills, as well as kitchen management and restaurant management and business principles. Sustainable Hospitality and Tourism Management (SHTM) The Sustainable Hospitality and Tourism Management program is designed to provide students with the knowledge and skills necessary to pursue employment or business ownership in the hospitality and tourism industry. In addition to understanding corporate practices, students will also acquire project management and entrepreneurship knowledge and skills to support independent and small business operations. Program focus will lean toward the promotion of sustainable practices that promote, and allow to flourish, the cultural and environmental attributes of the state. text: Culinary Arts | Hawaiâi Career Pathways Home Pathways & Programs Agriculture, Food, and Natural Resources Animal Systems (AS) Food Systems (FS) Agriculture and Food Production (AFP) Business Natural Resources Management (NRM) Building and Construction Mechanical, Electrical, and Plumbing (MEP) Systems Residential and Commercial Construction (RCC) Cultural Arts, Media, and Entertainment Digital Design (DD) Fashion and Artisan Design (FAD) Film and Media Production (FMP) Education Learning Support Professional (LSP) Teaching As a Profession (TAP) Health Services Public Health Services (PHS) Diagnostic Services (DS) Emergency Medical Services (EMS/EMT) Human Performance Therapeutic Services (HPTS) Nursing Services (NS) Hospitality, Tourism, and Recreation Culinary Arts (CA) Sustainable Hospitality and Tourism Management (HOST) Information Technology and Digital Transformation Artificial Intelligence (AI) Programming Networking Cybersecurity (Cyber) Web Design and Development (WDD) Transportation Services Automotive Maintenance and Light Repair (MLR) Automotive Collision Repair (ACR) Aviation Maintenance Technology (AMT) Marine Maintenance Technology (MMT) Resources Contact Us Culinary Arts (CULN) Home Pathways and Programs Hospitality, Tourism and Recreation Culinary Arts Culinary Arts Pathway Map to Employment High school students aspiring to enter the Culinary Arts industry should focus on building a strong foundation. Start by taking culinary classes if offered at school, and consider volunteering or working part-time in restaurants or bakeries to gain practical experience. Experiment with cooking at home, exploring diverse cuisines and techniques. Seek out opportunities to learn from experienced chefs, whether through shadowing or mentorship programs. Additionally, developing strong communication and teamwork skills is crucial, as the culinary world is a collaborative environment. Students in the Culinary program of study in high school will have the opportunity to lay the foundation for their journey into this field with a clear understanding of the role and responsibilities as well as work based learning opportunities to help them understand the current landscape of this industry. The map below shows various education and training pathway opportunities available in HawaiÊ»i, starting high school and leading you to a job here in HawaiÊ»i. The Breakdown of the Map Starting in the Culinary program of study in high school you will be introduced to key concepts, overall understanding of the field and the opportunity to explore the industry through work based learning to ensure this career path is the right fit for you. A career in Residential and Commercial Construction may require additional education depending on the path you want to pursue. While more training might be required, you may also be able to attain entry level certifications/courses that will allow you to work in the field right after high school. Community College Track (2+ Years) University Track (4+ Years) Training Programs (< 1-Year) How to use the map. Map Overview: The large map shows all the possible educational and training pathways available in Hawaii. You can click on any of the bubbles to obtain more information. Start Your Journey: If you prefer a guided approach, you can click on âStart Your Journeyâ in the upper left corner of the map. This will take you through various screens and include enlargements of the selected areas of the map overview. Admissions Requirement: As you navigate the map, be sure to read the admission requirements for the Community College and University Track Programs. You must meet admissions requirements to enroll in these programs. Bridging the Gap Students need to learn the right skills today to succeed in the jobs of tomorrow. subcontent.title: Culinary Arts Entry Level Jobs and Training Programs | Hawaiâi Career Pathways
subcontent.text: Culinary Arts Entry Level Jobs and Training Programs | Hawaiâi Career Pathways Home Pathways & Programs Agriculture, Food, and Natural Resources Animal Systems (AS) Food Systems (FS) Agriculture and Food Production (AFP) Business Natural Resources Management (NRM) Architectural Design and Engineering Technology Architectural Design (AD) Engineering Building and Construction Mechanical, Electrical, and Plumbing (MEP) Systems Residential and Commercial Construction (RCC) Cultural Arts, Media, and Entertainment Digital Design (DD) Fashion and Artisan Design (FAD) Film and Media Entertainment (FME) Education Learning Support Professional (LSP) Teaching As a Profession (TAP) Health Services Public Health Services (PHS) Diagnostic Services (DS) Emergency Medical Services (EMS/EMT) Human Performance Therapeutic Services (HPTS) Nursing Services (NS) Hospitality, Tourism, and Recreation Culinary Arts (CA) Sustainable Hospitality and Tourism Management (SHTM) Information Technology and Digital Transformation Artificial Intelligence (AI) Programming Networking Cybersecurity (Cyber) Web Design and Development (WDD) Transportation Services Automotive Maintenance and Light Repair (MLR) Automotive Collision Repair (ACR) Aviation Maintenance Technology (AMT) Marine Maintenance Technology (MMT) Resources Contact Us Culinary Arts ENTRY LEVEL JOBS/ TRAINING PROGRAMS Home Pathways & Programs Entry Level Jobs-Training Programs For entry-level positions in Culinary Arts, several industry-related credentials can enhance your qualifications and demonstrate foundational knowledge and skills. Some of those certifications can be done while you are in high school or shortly after graduation. The following are some NON-CREDIT (not related to college) programs you can take that will help you in your career journey. Take a look at Good Jobs Hawaiâi Entry Level Training Programs: Entry-level training for related careers can vary depending on the specific role and level of education required. Here are some common entry-level training options for Culinary Arts related careers: ServeSafe Certification: ServSafe certifications are preferred by most employers in the food service industry.  There are four types of certifications: ServSafe Food Handler, ServSafe Alcohol, ServSafe Food Manager, ServSafe Allergens.  The ServSafe Food Handlers certification fulfills the training requirement for a HawaiÊ»i Food Handlerâs Card. Range of program duration: 1 - 2 hours Food Handlers Card: The class is designed to provide the food handler with a basic understanding of food microbiology, major foodborne illnesses, and learn how to implement specific procedures to ensure safe food preparation. A Food Handlerâs Card prepares food handlers to enter the workforce by providing the required food safety information such as state or local government regulations. This certification is required in HawaiÊ»i when working with food. Range of program duration: 1 hour Basic Life Support (BLS) Certification: High school students can pursue BLS certification, which teaches cardiopulmonary resuscitation (CPR) and automated external defibrillator (AED) skills. BLS certification is often required for healthcare professionals, including nurses. Range of program duration: 2 - 4 hours OSHA 10: General Industry: Learn how to recognize and avoid common workplace hazards with this voluntary training program. This deep dive into OSHA safety standards is designed for entry-level workers in general industry roles. This 100% online course focuses on the prevention, recognition, avoidance and abatement of potential hazards at work. Range of program duration: 10 hours American Hotel & Lodging Educational Institute (AHLEI) Training & Certifications: AHLEI's comprehensive training programs equip hospitality staff with the necessary skills and knowledge to effectively address guests' unique needs, navigate regulatory changes, and optimize profitability. Use the industryâs best training programs to ensure consistent, high-quality service while safeguarding your property's success, competitiveness, compliance and staff advancement opportunities.  Hospitality certification provides recognition of mastery of professional knowledge and skills at every level of your hospitality career. AHLEI provides the study materials and administers the certification process for nearly 30 certification designations trademarked by the American Hotel & Lodging Association (AHLA). Range of program duration: 1-10 hours Theses training programs can lead to the following entry level Jobs: Restaurant worker Hotel food and beverage worker Entry level chef and cook positions Bridging the Gap Students need to learn the right skills today to succeed in the jobs of tomorrow. subcontent.text: Culinary Arts Admission Requirements | Hawaiâi Career Pathways Home Pathways & Programs Agriculture, Food, and Natural Resources Animal Systems (AS) Food Systems (FS) Agriculture and Food Production (AFP) Business Natural Resources Management (NRM) Architectural Design and Engineering Technology Architectural Design (AD) Engineering Building and Construction Mechanical, Electrical, and Plumbing (MEP) Systems Residential and Commercial Construction (RCC) Cultural Arts, Media, and Entertainment Digital Design (DD) Fashion and Artisan Design (FAD) Film and Media Entertainment (FME) Education Learning Support Professional (LSP) Teaching As a Profession (TAP) Health Services Public Health Services (PHS) Diagnostic Services (DS) Emergency Medical Services (EMS/EMT) Human Performance Therapeutic Services (HPTS) Nursing Services (NS) Hospitality, Tourism, and Recreation Culinary Arts (CA) Sustainable Hospitality and Tourism Management (SHTM) Information Technology and Digital Transformation Artificial Intelligence (AI) Programming Networking Cybersecurity (Cyber) Web Design and Development (WDD) Transportation Services Automotive Maintenance and Light Repair (MLR) Automotive Collision Repair (ACR) Aviation Maintenance Technology (AMT) Marine Maintenance Technology (MMT) Resources Contact Us Culinary Arts Admission Requirements Home Pathways & Programs Admission Requirements High school students interested in entering the Culinary Arts industry should start by building a strong foundation in culinary, business and hospitality through either CTE Pathway or Early College courses. Students should also consider seeking internships, joining clubs, or work experience to gain real-world knowledge and insights into local industry trends. The basic admissions requirements can include: Course prerequisites: Some programs have specific prerequisite coursework that must be completed before applying. (see campus program page for more details). GPA requirements: Some programs have minimum GPA requirements that students must meet with all prerequisite courses. These requirements can vary per campus. Application process: Certain programs will have a detailed set of application requirements such as submitting a written personal statement, and professional reference letters or interviewing with the program. Field or work experience: Having experience with agriculture through internships, part time jobs, work-based learning experiences or a students own social capital will give an advantage when applying for some programs. For specific prerequisite courses, and admissions requirements, select the campus via our career maps. UH Community Colleges To apply for admission to a UH Community College with the intent to select an education program, you must: Be 18 years of age or older, or Have earned a U.S. high school diploma, GED, or equivalency certificate *Please see individual community college websites for course placement information The following UH Community College campuses have associates degree programs associated with Culinary Arts: KapiÊ»olani Community College Leeward Community College KauaÊ»i Community College HawaiÊ»i Community College UH Maui College * University of HawaiÊ»i at Manoa * University of HawaiÊ»i Hilo * University of HawaiÊ»i West Oahu For general admission to these UH university campuses with the intent to later apply for their programs, you must: Know and provide your current high school GPA Have taken the following high school course requirements: 4 units of English (*journalism and/or newswriting do not count as English credits) 3 units of Math (including Algebra I, Algebra II, and Geometry) 3 units of Science (laboratory courses recommended) 3 units of Social Studies 4 units of other college-prep courses at UHM/UHWO or 7 units of other college-prep courses at UH Hilo College-prep courses can include a 4th unit of math, science, or social science. High school foreign language courses count toward other college-prep courses, but is not required . Certain programs (e.g., nursing, social work, education, etc.) may have additional requirements. Please check with the appropriate department for more information. 5 units of electives (Examples of elective courses: Art, Dance, Band, Physical Education, AVID, Computer Science, etc.) If available, SAT or ACT scores (optional) Other supplemental documents (might be required for individual programs) Letter(s) of Recommendation Personal Statement & List of Achievements form For campus specific requirements, please see individual campus pages via our career map *HawaiÊ»i Pacific University: HPU understands that each student has a unique academic history and individual talents. This is why HPU takes a holistic approach to reviewing applications, and considers all the information provided on your application to make an admissions decision. For more admissions information, please visit the HPU Admissions website . What is CONSIDERED: Grade Point Average - GPA SAT and/or ACT scores (or English Proficiency if educated outside of the US) Extracurricular activities Personal statement (essay) and/or resume Academic area of interest Bridging the Gap Students need to learn the right skills today to succeed in the jobs of tomorrow. subcontent.title: UH West âOahu Culinary Management Program | Hawaiâi Career Pathways
subcontent.text: UH West âOahu Culinary Management Program | Hawaiâi Career Pathways Home Pathways & Programs Agriculture, Food, and Natural Resources Animal Systems (AS) Food Systems (FS) Agriculture and Food Production (AFP) Business Natural Resources Management (NRM) Building and Construction Mechanical, Electrical, and Plumbing (MEP) Systems Residential and Commercial Construction (RCC) Cultural Arts, Media, and Entertainment Digital Design (DD) Fashion and Artisan Design (FAD) Film and Media Production (FMP) Education Learning Support Professional (LSP) Teaching As a Profession (TAP) Health Services Public Health Services (PHS) Diagnostic Services (DS) Emergency Medical Services (EMS/EMT) Human Performance Therapeutic Services (HPTS) Nursing Services (NS) Hospitality, Tourism, and Recreation Culinary Arts (CA) Sustainable Hospitality and Tourism Management (HOST) Information Technology and Digital Transformation Artificial Intelligence (AI) Programming Networking Cybersecurity (Cyber) Web Design and Development (WDD) Transportation Services Automotive Maintenance and Light Repair (MLR) Automotive Collision Repair (ACR) Aviation Maintenance Technology (AMT) Marine Maintenance Technology (MMT) Resources Contact Us Culinary Management Program Home Hospitality, Tourism, Recreation Culinary Management Program Description: The concentration in Culinary Management provides culinary students and those already working in the industry with the strong business background needed to excel in the workforce. Students will develop an understanding of the management, marketing, ethical and legal aspects of running a food service operation. They will also learn valuable communication and leadership skills that are essential for higher-level management positions. Traditionally, many restaurant managers build their careers on experience, not education, making a degree a highly valuable asset. The curriculum is designed to supplement Kapiâolani Community Collegeâs (KCCâs) award-winning culinary arts program , an associateâs program where students learn the technical skills of the trade. The Culinary Institute of the Pacific at Diamond Head is home to students seeking the third-year Advanced Professional Certificate in Culinary Management Arts, which articulates into the Bachelor of Applied Science at UH West Oâahu. Courses at UH West Oâahu are delivered through in-class and distance learning instruction. KCC offers in-class courses in a world-class learning environment that includes 10 modern kitchens, a 100-seat culinary demonstration auditorium for demonstrations and broadcasting/remote learning as well as baking and patisserie laboratories, and banquet rooms. Apply Now Contact Program Dr. Frank Kudo Contact Information (808) 689-2331 fkudo@hawaii.edu Contact Program Counselor Rebecca Carino-Agustin Program Counselor (808) 689-2689 rtcarino@hawaii.edu Program Prerequisites: Complete KapiÊ»olani Community College, AS Culinary Arts and the Advanced Professional Certificate in Culinary Management Arts Admissions to UH West âOahu Cost and time commitment: Cost per credit: $306 Total number of credits: 60 UH West âOahu credits Approximate total program tuition costs: $18,360 UH West âOahu tuition Estimated program length: 2 years at UH West âOahu Financial Aid Resources Recommended College Courses during High School: The courses listed below are recommended for high school students to complete through a dual credit program such as Early College when in high school. We hope to inspire our students to celebrate the diversity of food and cultures throughout the world and elevate their knowledge and appreciation of culinary arts. The competency-based instruction focuses on skills, knowledge, and attitudes needed for success in the hospitality industry. subcontent.title: UH MÄnoa Food Science & Human Nutrition Program | Hawaiâi Career Pathways
subcontent.text: UH MÄnoa Food Science & Human Nutrition Program | Hawaiâi Career Pathways Home Pathways & Programs Agriculture, Food, and Natural Resources Animal Systems (AS) Food Systems (FS) Agriculture and Food Production (AFP) Business Natural Resources Management (NRM) Building and Construction Mechanical, Electrical, and Plumbing (MEP) Systems Residential and Commercial Construction (RCC) Cultural Arts, Media, and Entertainment Digital Design (DD) Fashion and Artisan Design (FAD) Film and Media Production (FMP) Education Learning Support Professional (LSP) Teaching As a Profession (TAP) Health Services Public Health Services (PHS) Diagnostic Services (DS) Emergency Medical Services (EMS/EMT) Human Performance Therapeutic Services (HPTS) Nursing Services (NS) Hospitality, Tourism, and Recreation Culinary Arts (CA) Sustainable Hospitality and Tourism Management (HOST) Information Technology and Digital Transformation Artificial Intelligence (AI) Programming Networking Cybersecurity (Cyber) Web Design and Development (WDD) Transportation Services Automotive Maintenance and Light Repair (MLR) Automotive Collision Repair (ACR) Aviation Maintenance Technology (AMT) Marine Maintenance Technology (MMT) Resources Contact Us Food Science & Human Nutrition Program Home Hospitality, Tourism, Recreation Food Science Program Description: Program website: https://cms.ctahr.hawaii.edu/hnfas/Academics/FoodSci There are Five Exciting Tracks Within the FSHN (BS) Program: Food Science: Business Combine nutrition coursework with classes in business management This study track educates and develops skills in students who desire to work in food processing, regulation and food business arena, both in the public and private sector. This track also prepares students for managerial positions since there is a high demand for people with skills in food science and knowledge of business, accounting, and interpersonal skills. Students learn about food chemistry, microbiology, structure, engineering, safety, regulation, sanitation, quality control, and business. Food Science: Pre-Professional Combine nutrition coursework with classes in business management This study track educates and develops skills in students who desire to work in food processing, regulation and food business arena, both in the public and private sector. This track also prepares students for managerial positions since there is a high demand for people with skills in food science and knowledge of business, accounting, and interpersonal skills. Students learn about food chemistry, microbiology, structure, engineering, safety, regulation, sanitation, quality control, and business. Culinology Blend culinary arts with the science of food A new and exciting field involving the blend of culinary arts and the science of food!  The Food Science & Human Nutrition Culinology option at the University of Hawai'i at MÄnoa is a 2+2 program that offers graduates of KapiÊ»olani Community College's Culinary Arts Associate's in Science (AS) program an opportunity to pursue a Bachelor's of Science (BS) degree from the Department of Human Nutrition, Food and Animal Sciences. Sports and Wellness Augment nutrition coursework with classes in exercise science Students who are interested in pursuing a career in sports and wellness, are encouraged to complete course work in applied musculo-skeletal anatomy, exercise physiology (KRS 353 and 354), and nutrition in exercise and sport (FSHN 480). This track prepares students for careers at health clubs, fitness centers, and spas. Pre-Professional Human Nutrition Prepare for post-baccalaureate study in medicine, dentistry, nutrition, or other graduate program This course of study allows students to study other areas of science, foods, and nutrition. With guidance from their advisor, students can design a course of study to meet their course requirements to prepare them for different aspects of applied nutrition, food science, post- baccalaureate studies in other health professional programs (medicine, dental, pharmacy), or an advanced research degree in nutrition or other biomedical sciences. However, this course of study does not meet all the undergraduate academic course work requirements of the Academy of Nutrition and Dietetics. subcontent.title: Aviation Maintenance Technology Entry Level Jobs and Training Programs | Hawaiâi Career Pathways
subcontent.text:
Aviation Maintenance Technology Entry Level Jobs and Training Programs | Hawaiâi Career Pathways Home Pathways & Programs Agriculture, Food, and Natural Resources Animal Systems (AS) Food Systems (FS) Agriculture and Food Production (AFP) Business Natural Resources Management (NRM) Architectural Design and Engineering Technology Architectural Design (AD) Engineering Building and Construction Mechanical, Electrical, and Plumbing (MEP) Systems Residential and Commercial Construction (RCC) Cultural Arts, Media, and Entertainment Digital Design (DD) Fashion and Artisan Design (FAD) Film and Media Entertainment (FME) Education Learning Support Professional (LSP) Teaching As a Profession (TAP) Health Services Public Health Services (PHS) Diagnostic Services (DS) Emergency Medical Services (EMS/EMT) Human Performance Therapeutic Services (HPTS) Nursing Services (NS) Hospitality, Tourism, and Recreation Culinary Arts (CA) Sustainable Hospitality and Tourism Management (SHTM) Information Technology and Digital Transformation Artificial Intelligence (AI) Programming Networking Cybersecurity (Cyber) Web Design and Development (WDD) Transportation Services Automotive Maintenance and Light Repair (MLR) Automotive Collision Repair (ACR) Aviation Maintenance Technology (AMT) Marine Maintenance Technology (MMT) Resources Contact Us Aviation Maintenance Technology
			    ENTRY LEVEL JOBS/ TRAINING PROGRAMS Home Pathways & Programs Transportation Entry Level Jobs-Training Programs See a current list of FREE post high school training programs currently available through the University of Hawaiâi Community Colleges. Take a look at Good Jobs Hawaiâi For entry-level positions in the aviation maintenance technology industry, several industry-related credentials can enhance your qualifications and demonstrate foundational knowledge and skills. Some of those certifications can be done while you are in high school or shortly after graduation. The following are some NON-CREDIT (not related to college) programs you can take that will help you in your career journey. Entry Level Training Programs: Entry-level training for related careers can vary depending on the specific role and level of education required. Here are some common entry-level training options for aviation maintenance technology related careers: OSHA 10 General - If youâre an entry-level worker, our OSHA 10-Hour Outreach General & Healthcare Industry course is your orientation to occupational safety and health. As part of OSHA's Outreach Training program to raise awareness about the safety measures under OSHA 29 CFR 1910, this course will help teach you how to improve workplace safety. Youâll learn OSHA's best practices for reducing accidents and injuries, including fall protection, emergency evacuation plans, and the use of personal protective equipment. You'll also learn about the major hazards you might encounter in general industry work and solutions for recognizing, controlling, and protecting against them. This includes flammable and combustible substances, chemical and electrical hazards, and fire prevention. Additionally, you should know what your employer's responsibility is for your safety, as well as the rights OSHA grants you as a worker. Thatâs why you'll learn how to file a complaint if your workplace isn't living up to its safety obligations. Range of training duration: 10 hours Basic Life Support (BLS) Certification: High school students can pursue BLS certification, which teaches cardiopulmonary resuscitation (CPR) and automated external defibrillator (AED) skills. BLS certification is often required for construction professionals. Range of program duration: 2 - 4 hours Commercial Drivers License Training (CDL): A Commercial Driverâs License (CDL) is essential in the construction industry for operating heavy vehicles such as dump trucks, cement mixers, and tractor-trailers. Workers with a CDL play a critical role in transporting materials, equipment, and machinery to and from construction sites. Obtaining a CDL involves meeting specific requirements, including passing written and skills tests tailored to the type of vehicle being driven. CDL certification ensures that drivers are trained in safety protocols, vehicle operation, and compliance with transportation regulations, making it a valuable credential for construction professionals. Range of program duration: 4-8 Weeks Scissor Lift Certification: Aerial and scissor lifts play an important role in construction and many other industries. These versatile lifts come in several types with various applications and operating hazards. This course will teach you how to maximize worksite safety while working on or around aerial and scissor lifts. Only trained persons may operate aerial lifts and scissor lifts. This awareness-level certificate course complies with training requirements for aerial lifts and related scaffolding equipment found in OSHA standard 1926.454. It does not provide an OSHA-accepted certification or certification card. Range of program duration: 1-2 Hours These training programs can lead to the following entry level Jobs: Laborer Forklift operator Truck Driver Bridging the Gap Students need to learn the right skills today to succeed in the jobs of tomorrow.
