subcontent.text: Leeward Community College Information & Computer Science | Hawaiâi Career Pathways Home Pathways & Programs Agriculture, Food, and Natural Resources Animal Systems (AS) Food Systems (FS) Agriculture and Food Production (AFP) Business Natural Resources Management (NRM) Building and Construction Mechanical, Electrical, and Plumbing (MEP) Systems Residential and Commercial Construction (RCC) Cultural Arts, Media, and Entertainment Digital Design (DD) Fashion and Artisan Design (FAD) Film and Media Production (FMP) Education Learning Support Professional (LSP) Teaching As a Profession (TAP) Health Services Public Health Services (PHS) Diagnostic Services (DS) Emergency Medical Services (EMS/EMT) Human Performance Therapeutic Services (HPTS) Nursing Services (NS) Hospitality, Tourism, and Recreation Culinary Arts (CA) Sustainable Hospitality and Tourism Management (SHTM) Information Technology and Digital Transformation Artificial Intelligence (AI) Programming Networking Cybersecurity (Cyber) Web Design and Development (WDD) Transportation Services Automotive Maintenance and Light Repair (MLR) Automotive Collision Repair (ACR) Aviation Maintenance Technology (AMT) Marine Maintenance Technology (MMT) Resources Contact Us Information & Computer Science Home Networking Information & Computer Science Program Description: The curriculum leading to an Associate in Science degree in Information and Computer Science is designed to prepare individuals for employment as technical assistants to professional and administrative personnel using computers. Students may choose one of five areas of specialty: Network Support Specialist, Information Security Specialist, Software Developer Specialist, Data Science Specialist, and Cloud Security Specialist. Skills in writing, speech, and mathematics complete the preparation for employment. In addition to training the student for work in the technical areas mentioned earlier, the program requirements are designed to facilitate transfer to the baccalaureate programs in Information and Computer Sciences at UH MÄnoa, UH Hilo, and UH West O'ahu for those students who wish to continue their education while working in the industry. Apply Now Contact Program Coordinator Michael Bauer Program Coordinator (808) 455-0310 mbauer@hawaii.edu Contact Program Counselor Amy Amper Program Counselor (808) 455-0235 amyamper@hawaii.edu Program Prerequisites: None Industry Related Credentials: Certain ICS  courses also help to prepare you to take the following industry certification exams: CompTIA A+ CompTIA Networking+ CompTIA Security+ CompTIA Linux+ CompTIA PenTest+ CISCO Certified Network Associate (CCNA) Certified Ethical Hacker (CEH) Cost and time commitment: Cost per credit: $131 Total number of credits 60 Approximate total program tuition costs: $7,869-$8,646 Estimated program length: 2 years (based on 15-18 credits per semester) Financial Aid Resources Recommended College Courses during High School: The courses listed below are recommended for high school students to complete through a dual credit program such as Early College when in high school. These courses meet degree requirements for the Leeward Community College program. General Academic Courses: ENG 100 Composition I *Prerequisite - Grade or credit in EN 22 or 24, OR Placement into ENG 100 Math 103 College Algebra *Prerequisite - Grade or credit in Math 82X, OR Placement into MATH 103 or higher. Program Specific Courses: ICS 101 Digital Tools for the Information World *Prerequisite - None ICS 111 Introduction to Computer Science *Prerequisite - ENG 22 or 24, Math 82X OR High STEM Math (check with campus for qualifying courses) *Prerequisites are courses or other background that must be completed PRIOR to enrollment. Prerequisites are REQUIRED for registration.  Please contact program coordinator or advisor for information on placement into courses as there are multiple methods of placement per campus. National Center for Academic Excellence in Cybersecurity (NCAE-C): Designation: CAE - Cyber Defense Education Sponsored by the National Security Agency (NSA), CAE-C designations are awarded to institutions that commit to producing cybersecurity professionals that will reduce vulnerabilities in our national infrastructure. Leeward Community College's Cybersecurity Center showcases a variety of cybersecurity related programs and resources available to students and faculty. The core Cyber Defense program at Leeward CC is in the Information and Computer Science program (ICS) , which provides students with a wide background in information and computer science including programming, networking, operating systems, and security fundamentals. Embedded in this program are Certificates of Achievement in Information Security, and Certificate of Competence in Information Security. These certificates are built on the Knowledge Unit (KU) requirements for a collegiate institution to be recognized as a CAE-CD. subcontent.title: Kapiâolani Community College Information Technology Program | Hawaiâi Career Pathways
subcontent.text: Kapiâolani Community College Information Technology Program | Hawaiâi Career Pathways Home Pathways & Programs Agriculture, Food, and Natural Resources Animal Systems (AS) Food Systems (FS) Agriculture and Food Production (AFP) Business Natural Resources Management (NRM) Building and Construction Mechanical, Electrical, and Plumbing (MEP) Systems Residential and Commercial Construction (RCC) Cultural Arts, Media, and Entertainment Digital Design (DD) Fashion and Artisan Design (FAD) Film and Media Production (FMP) Education Learning Support Professional (LSP) Teaching As a Profession (TAP) Health Services Public Health Services (PHS) Diagnostic Services (DS) Emergency Medical Services (EMS/EMT) Human Performance Therapeutic Services (HPTS) Nursing Services (NS) Hospitality, Tourism, and Recreation Culinary Arts (CA) Sustainable Hospitality and Tourism Management (SHTM) Information Technology and Digital Transformation Artificial Intelligence (AI) Programming Networking Cybersecurity (Cyber) Web Design and Development (WDD) Transportation Services Automotive Maintenance and Light Repair (MLR) Automotive Collision Repair (ACR) Aviation Maintenance Technology (AMT) Marine Maintenance Technology (MMT) Resources Contact Us Information Technology Program Home Networking Information Technology Program Description: The Information Technology program is career-laddered and competency-based. The program focuses on strong programming fundamentals, network connectivity, hands-on type projects, front-end graphical user interface (GUI) programming with strong connectivity to databases such as Microsoft ACCESS, Microsoft SQL Server, and Oracle in a stand alone as well as web environment. It provides training in the use and support of business-related computer systems, data communication networks (including local area networks), World Wide Web and its importance to businesses, and the development of business information technology systems programs using procedural and object-oriented programming techniques. The program includes a combination of business, computer, and information technology courses. Campus-based computer and networking projects, faculty-supervised laboratories, and workplace internships provide hands-on experience designed to prepare students for positions in computer support, programming, network hardware set up and configuration, or systems development in a business information technology system. The program focuses on computers, the Internet and the World Wide Web, and information technology as tools to solve business problems. The program trains students in the management of storage and the use of client-server environments in the accessing, processing, storing, and networking of information on computer-based business systems. Todayâs modern computing environment is a network of interrelated computer systems with connections via a local area network, wide area network, and the Internet. These computer-systems provide access to a variety of information to facilitate the operation of a business. The Information Technology program atKapiÊ»olani Community Collegeâs ensures student currency in these areas through courses in information technology. Apply Now Contact Program Coordinator David Stevens Program Coordinator (808) 734-9843 dsteven3@hawaii.edu Program Prerequisites: Placement into English 100 Placement into Math 103 Industry Related Credentials: Certain IT courses also help to prepare you to take the following industry certification exams: CompTIA A+ CompTIA Network+ CompTIA Security+ Cost and time commitment: Cost per credit: $131 Total number of credits 60-62 Approximate total program tuition costs: $7,869-$8,646 Estimated program length: 2 years (based on 15-18 credits per semester) Financial Aid Resources Recommended College Courses during High School: The courses listed below are recommended for high school students to complete through a dual credit program such as Early College when in high school. These courses meet degree requirements for the Kapiolani Community College IT  program. General Academic Courses: ENG 100 Composition I *Prerequisite - âCâ or better in ENG 22, OR placement into ENG 100 Math 103 College Algebra *Prerequisite - âCâ or better in MATH 82, OR placement into ENG 103 Program Specific Courses: ICS 101: Digital tools for the informational world *Prerequisite - Placement into ENG 100, AND Placement into MATH 103 ICS 111 Introduction to Computer Science *Prerequisite - Placement into MATH 135 or higher *Prerequisites are courses or other background that must be completed PRIOR to enrollment. Prerequisites are REQUIRED for registration.  Please contact program coordinator or advisor for information on placement into courses as there are multiple methods of placement per campus. National Center for Academic Excellence in Cybersecurity (NCAE-C): Designation: CAE - Cyber Defense Education Sponsored by the National Security Agency (NSA), CAE-C designations are awarded to institutions that commit to producing cybersecurity professionals that will reduce vulnerabilities in our national infrastructure. KapiÊ»olani Community College was named a National Center of Academic Excellence in Cyber Defense (CAE-CD) by the National Security Agency (NSA) and the Department of Homeland Security (DHS). The CAE-CD designation is awarded to regionally accredited academic institutions that offer high-quality cybersecurity-related degrees and certificates. The CAE-CD designation is based on a combination of elements related to the institution, focused on outputs for determining academic achievement. As a recognized institution, KapiÊ»olani CC has demonstrated that it engages in significant community involvement, embeds cybersecurity awareness in classes throughout the campus, encourages faculty professional development, integrates cybersecurity practices within the institution and prepares students to meet the growing need for professionals with cybersecurity skills. âThrough the guidance of the NSA and DHS to become a CAE-CD institution, our cybersecurity learning pathway incorporates real-life scenarios, critical-thinking and problem-solving exercises, hands-on labs, industry certificate preparation and cooperative decision-making activities, resulting in fully prepared cybersecurity professionals,â said KapiÊ»olani CC IT Director Dale Nakasone. âThe CAE designation will benefit graduates from KapiÊ»olani CC who will have the potential to become highly sought after as candidates for high-paying industry careers.â Transfer Agreements (Articulation)*: Students who complete the Associate of Science degree in IT may apply to transfer to the following programs via a transfer agreement with the 4-year university programs listed below. UH West Oahu - Bachelors of Applied Science in Information Technology ( Articulation Agreement - Fall 2019 ) Transfer agreements (also known as Articulation Agreements) are individual agreements between programs that facilitate a smooth transition from 2-year associate degree programs to 4-year bachelor degree programs. This 60 credit program provides clear, explicit, coherent pathways for students intending to transfer into Science, Technology, Engineering and Mathematics (STEM) majors at baccalaureate institutions. The program provides curricula that focus on basic science and mathematics as well as more advanced research and mentoring experiences. The degree provides students with undergraduate research opportunities as they move through STEM curricular pathways. subcontent.title: Maui College Electronic and Computer Engineering Technology | Hawaiâi Career Pathways
subcontent.text: Maui College Electronic and Computer Engineering Technology | Hawaiâi Career Pathways Home Pathways & Programs Agriculture, Food, and Natural Resources Animal Systems (AS) Food Systems (FS) Agriculture and Food Production (AFP) Business Natural Resources Management (NRM) Building and Construction Mechanical, Electrical, and Plumbing (MEP) Systems Residential and Commercial Construction (RCC) Cultural Arts, Media, and Entertainment Digital Design (DD) Fashion and Artisan Design (FAD) Film and Media Production (FMP) Education Learning Support Professional (LSP) Teaching As a Profession (TAP) Health Services Public Health Services (PHS) Diagnostic Services (DS) Emergency Medical Services (EMS/EMT) Human Performance Therapeutic Services (HPTS) Nursing Services (NS) Hospitality, Tourism, and Recreation Culinary Arts (CA) Sustainable Hospitality and Tourism Management (SHTM) Information Technology and Digital Transformation Artificial Intelligence (AI) Programming Networking Cybersecurity (Cyber) Web Design and Development (WDD) Transportation Services Automotive Maintenance and Light Repair (MLR) Automotive Collision Repair (ACR) Aviation Maintenance Technology (AMT) Marine Maintenance Technology (MMT) Resources Contact Us Electronic & Computer Engineering Technology Home Networking ECET Program Description: What is ECET? The E lectronic and Computer Engineering Technology (ECET) program is designed to train students in theory and practical skills for application-oriented engineering technology careers. Students typically engage in hands-on experiments and real-world projects to solve practical problems or create tangible outcomes. Theory: Electronic Circuit Analysis (DC, AC), Digital Computer Technology, Computer Programming (Java, Python, MATLAB, C++), Computer Networking, Optics. Practical Skills: Soldering, Solidworks (Computer Aided Design), Simulink (Graphical programming environment for modeling, simulating and analyzing multi domain dynamical systems), 3D-printing, Arduino (Microcontroller), Adaptive Optics. How long does it take? The time to complete the AS degree in ECET varies. To obtain the associate degree in two years, students need to take an average of 15 credits/semester, and place into ENG 100 (Composition I) and MATH 103 (College Algebra). What will AS ECET graduates do? Assist engineers in design, assembling, and testing of prototypes. Install, diagnose, test, maintain and repair computer systems; digital communication equipment; industrial control systems to include motor controllers, program logic controllers, sensors, and robotics; communication systems; and various common and advanced electronic equipment/systems. What careers for AS ECET graduates? AS ECET graduates may work in industries that include, but are not limited to, electronics, control systems, robotics, aerospace, biotechnology, communications, entertainment, industrial, medical, energy, power, semiconductor, microprocessors, alternative energy, and transportation. What jobs for AS ECET graduates? AS ECET graduates may be hired as entry-level electronic/electro-optic technicians, renewable energy technicians, telecom/network technicians, and any positions in organizations that specialize in electronic design, manufacturing, service, and development. ECET Programs offered: Electronic & Computer Engineering Technology, Associate in Science (AS), 61-62 Credits Electronic & Computer Engineering Technology, Certificate of Achievement (CA), 24-25 Credits Information Security Specialist, Certificate of Achievement (CA), 24 Credits Information Security Specialist, Certificate of Competence (CO), 12 Credits Apply Now Contact Program Coordinator Jung Won Park Program Coordinator (808) 984-3423 parkjung@hawaii.edu Contact Program Counselor Eri Nomura Program Counselor (808) 984-3497 eri4@hawaii.edu Program Prerequisites: Placement in ENG 100 Cost and time commitment: Cost per credit: $131 Total number of credits 62-63 Approximate total program tuition costs: $8,122 - $8,253 Estimated program length: 2 years (based on 15-18 credits per semester) Financial Aid Resources Recommended College Courses during High School: The courses listed below are recommended for high school students to complete through a dual credit program such as Early College when in high school. These courses meet degree requirements for the UH Maui College ECET Program: General Academic Courses: ENG 100 Composition I *Prerequisite - âCâ or better in ENG 22, OR Placement into ENG 100 Math 103: College Algebra *Prerequisite - âCâ or better in ENG 22, OR Placement into ENG 100, AND âCâ or better in MATH 82 or placement into MATH 103 Program Specific Courses: ICS 110: Introduction to Programming *Prerequisite - None ICS 111: Introduction to Computer Science I *Prerequisite - âCâ or better in ICS 110, and âCâ or better in MATH 82, or placement into MATH 103, AND âCâ or better in ENG 19, or placement in ENG 22 or higher. *Prerequisites are courses or other background that must be completed PRIOR to enrollment. Prerequisites are REQUIRED for registration. Please contact program coordinator or advisor for information on placement into courses as there are multiple methods of placement per campus. subcontent.text: Maui College Applied Business and Information Technology | Hawaiâi Career Pathways Home Pathways & Programs Agriculture, Food, and Natural Resources Animal Systems (AS) Food Systems (FS) Agriculture and Food Production (AFP) Business Natural Resources Management (NRM) Building and Construction Mechanical, Electrical, and Plumbing (MEP) Systems Residential and Commercial Construction (RCC) Cultural Arts, Media, and Entertainment Digital Design (DD) Fashion and Artisan Design (FAD) Film and Media Production (FMP) Education Learning Support Professional (LSP) Teaching As a Profession (TAP) Health Services Public Health Services (PHS) Diagnostic Services (DS) Emergency Medical Services (EMS/EMT) Human Performance Therapeutic Services (HPTS) Nursing Services (NS) Hospitality, Tourism, and Recreation Culinary Arts (CA) Sustainable Hospitality and Tourism Management (SHTM) Information Technology and Digital Transformation Artificial Intelligence (AI) Programming Networking Cybersecurity (Cyber) Web Design and Development (WDD) Transportation Services Automotive Maintenance and Light Repair (MLR) Automotive Collision Repair (ACR) Aviation Maintenance Technology (AMT) Marine Maintenance Technology (MMT) Resources Contact Us Applied Business and Information Technology Home Networking ABIT Program Description: The BAS in Applied Business and Information Technology (ABIT) program offers a unique hybrid degree that emphasizes business, entrepreneurship, and technology skills. Upon completion of the ABIT program, many students apply for graduate programs, launch an entrepreneurial start-up, or accept employment in a small to large-sized company. The program can be completed in 4 years* (8 full-time semesters). Students who have completed an associate degree can transfer to the upper division program and complete the ABIT BAS in 4 semesters and 60 credits, using a traditional 16-week semester format. Apply Now Contact Program Coordinator Dr. Debasis Bhattacharya Program Coordinator (808) 984-3619 debasisb@hawaii.edu Program Prerequisites: Complete an associates degree in IT/ICS from an aligned community college (see articulation agreements below). Industry Related Credentials: Certain ABIT courses also help to prepare you to take the following industry certification exams: Microsoft Certifications: Security, Compliance and Identity Fundamentals Microsoft Certifications: Azure Data Fundamentals Microsoft Certifications: Azure Fundamentals Microsoft Certifications: Azure AI Fundamentals CompTIA Network+ CompTIA Security+ Google Certifications: Digital Marketing & E-Commerce Google Certifications: IT Support Google Certifications: Data Analytics Google Certifications: UX Design Google Certifications: Project Management Project Management Institute: Certified Associate in Project Management Cost and time commitment: $131 per lower division credit = $7,860 for the first 2 years in the 4 year program $306 per upper division credit = $18,360 for the last 2 years of either the 4 year program or the final 2 years for the upper division transfer students. 121 credits 60 credits (if you are upper division transfer students) Estimated program length: 4 years (based on 15-18 credits per semester) Financial Aid Resources Recommended College Courses during High School: The courses listed below are recommended for high school students to complete through a dual credit program such as Early College when in high school. These courses meet degree requirements for the HUH Maui College ABIT program. Prerequisites are REQUIRED for registration.  Please contact program coordinator or advisor for information on placement into courses as there are multiple methods of placement per campus National Center for Academic Excellence in Cybersecurity (NCAE-C): Designation: CAE - Cyber Defense Research Sponsored by the National Security Agency (NSA), CAE-C designations are awarded to institutions that commit to producing cybersecurity professionals that will reduce vulnerabilities in our national infrastructure. The University of Hawaii Maui College (UHMC) has been designated as a National Center of Academic Excellence (CAE) in Cyber Defense Education (CDE) through the academic year 2024 for the Bachelor of Applied Science (BAS) in Applied Business and Information Technology (ABIT) Degree . The Center for Cybersecurity Education and Research (CCER) was established at the University of Hawaii Maui College in 2015, to provide the local community and students with cybersecurity education, training and guidance. The mission of CCER is to provide cybersecurity guidance, training and workforce development activities to the local community, K-12 students and teachers, as well as students enrolled at UHMC. UH West OÊ»ahu, in cooperation with University of HawaiÊ»i Community Colleges, state and federal law enforcement agencies, state security officials, and local businesses, developed an expansive security education program covering a wide variety of technical and managerial aspects within the field. UH West OÊ»ahu offers a four-year program and several pathway programs in partnership with to provide graduates with a high-level management education and cutting-edge technical courses to succeed in cyber career fields. Students generally complete all coursework at the UH West OÊ»ahu campus or sequentially complete the associateâs degree at the community college level, earning automatic acceptance into the bachelorâs degree program (see articulation agreements below). Apply Now Contact Program Counselor Rebecca Carino Program Counselor (808) 689-2689 rtcarino@hawaii.edu Program Coordinator Michael Miranda, J.D. Program Coordinator (808) 689-2481 mmirand1@hawaii.edu Program Prerequisites: Admission to UH West OÊ»ahu Cost and time commitment: Cost per credit: $306 Total number of credits 120 (total after 2 years at CC and 2 years at UHWO) Approximate total program tuition costs: $36,720 (if all credits are taken at UH West Oahu) Estimated program length: 4 years (based on 15-18 credits per semester) Financial Aid Resources Recommended College Courses during High School: The courses listed below are recommended for high school students to complete through a dual credit program such as Early College when in high school. These courses meet degree requirements for the UHWO BAS - ISA program. General Academic Courses: ENG 100 Composition I *Prerequisite - Placement into ENG 100 MATH 115: Statistics *Prerequisite - âCâ or better in MATH 82, OR Placement into MATH 100 Program Specific Courses: ICS 101: Digital tools for the informational world *Prerequisite - None ICS 111: Introduction to Computer Science I *Prerequisite - âCâ or better in ICS 110, AND âCâ or better in MATH 82 or placement into MATH 103, AND âCâ or better in ENG 19 or placement into ENG 22 or higher. *Prerequisites are courses or other background that must be completed PRIOR to enrollment. Prerequisites are REQUIRED for registration.  Please contact program coordinator or advisor for information on placement into courses as there are multiple methods of placement per campus. National Center for Academic Excellence in Cybersecurity (NCAE-C): Designation: CAE - Cyber Defense Education Sponsored by the National Security Agency (NSA), CAE-C designations are awarded to institutions that commit to producing cybersecurity professionals that will reduce vulnerabilities in our national infrastructure. Based on the rapid expansion of cyberspace operations and the importance of cybersecurity to both industry and the Asia-Pacific Region, the University of Hawai'i - West O'ahu (UHWO) developed the Bachelor of Applied Science degree with a concentration in Information Security and Assurance and Bachelor of Science in Cybersecurity . These degree programs are the first of their kind at a public institution in Hawai'i and the Pacific, developed in response to national and state needs for graduates with expertise in cybersecurity. The BAS - ISA program is designated as a National Center of Academic Excellence in Cyber Defense Education (CAE-CD), certified by the National Security Agency (NSA) and the Department of Homeland Security (DHS). With the support of the Office of Naval Research, UHWO established the UHWO Cyber Security Coordination Center (CSCC) in order to further promote Cyber Workforce Development. CSCC students research and analyze global and technical cyber events in order to coordinate with and support local and regional partners. The Cybersecurity programs are the premiere workforce development degree programs at UH West Oahu, which has been one of the fastest growing four-year baccalaureate public schools in the nation. Transfer Agreements (Articulation)*: Students who complete the Associate of Science degree from the UH Community College programs listed below may apply to transfer to UHWO BAS ISA via a transfer agreement listed below. Honolulu CC - AS Computer, Security & Networking Technology (CSNT) to UH West Oahu BAS-ISA Leeward CC - AS Information Computer Science (ICS) to UH West Oahu BAS-ISA Windward CC - ASNS Information & Communication Technology (ASNS ICT) to UH West Oahu BAS-ISA Transfer agreements (also known as Articulation Agreements) are individual agreements between programs that facilitate a smooth transition from 2-year associate degree programs to 4-year bachelor degree programs. subcontent.text: UH at MÄnoa Computer Engineering | Hawaiâi Career Pathways Home Pathways & Programs Agriculture, Food, and Natural Resources Animal Systems (AS) Food Systems (FS) Agriculture and Food Production (AFP) Business Natural Resources Management (NRM) Building and Construction Mechanical, Electrical, and Plumbing (MEP) Systems Residential and Commercial Construction (RCC) Cultural Arts, Media, and Entertainment Digital Design (DD) Fashion and Artisan Design (FAD) Film and Media Production (FMP) Education Learning Support Professional (LSP) Teaching As a Profession (TAP) Health Services Public Health Services (PHS) Diagnostic Services (DS) Emergency Medical Services (EMS/EMT) Human Performance Therapeutic Services (HPTS) Nursing Services (NS) Hospitality, Tourism, and Recreation Culinary Arts (CA) Sustainable Hospitality and Tourism Management (SHTM) Information Technology and Digital Transformation Artificial Intelligence (AI) Programming Networking Cybersecurity (Cyber) Web Design and Development (WDD) Transportation Services Automotive Maintenance and Light Repair (MLR) Automotive Collision Repair (ACR) Aviation Maintenance Technology (AMT) Marine Maintenance Technology (MMT) Resources Contact Us Computer Engineering Home Networking BS Computer Engineering Program Description: The Department of Information and Computer Sciences and the Department of Electrical Engineering offer a joint Bachelor of Science degree in Computer Engineering (BS CE). The BS CE degree program provides you with the opportunity to learn about computer hardware and software, computer organization and architecture, computer security, software engineering, computer networks and Internet technology, embedded systems, computer-aided design, multi-core and parallel computing, wireless networks, and other topics stressing both hardware and software. Apply Now Program Prerequisites: Admission to UH MÄnoa Competition of General Education courses Cost and time commitment: Cost per credit: $441 Total number of credits 123: College of Engineering Requirements (51 credit hours) which includes calculus, chemistry, physics, economics, speech, and UH Manoa General Education requirements. BSCE Requirements (72 credit hours) CompE Core Courses (66 credit hours) CompE Technical Electives (6 credit hours) Approximate total program tuition costs: $54,243 Estimated program length: 4 years (based on 15-18 credits per semester) Financial Aid Resources Recommended College Courses during High School: The courses listed below are recommended for high school students to complete through a dual credit program such as Early College when in high school. These courses meet degree requirements for the UH Manoa BS in Computer Engineering program. General Academic Courses: ENG 100: Composition I *Prerequisite - Placement into ENG 100 COMG 251: Principles of Public Speaking (Same as SP 251 at UH community colleges) *Prerequisite - None MATH 134 (same as MATH 135 at UH community colleges) *Prerequisite - 2 years of high school algebra, one year of plane geometry *Prerequisites are courses or other background that must be completed PRIOR to enrollment. Prerequisites are REQUIRED for registration.  Please contact program coordinator or advisor for information on placement into courses as there are multiple methods of placement per campus. National Center for Academic Excellence in Cybersecurity (NCAE-C): Designation: CAE - Cyber Defense Research Sponsored by the National Security Agency (NSA), CAE-C designations are awarded to institutions that commit to producing cybersecurity professionals that will reduce vulnerabilities in our national infrastructure. The research of cybersecurity faculty at the University of HawaiÊ»i - Manoa (UHM) covers many critical issues, including cryptography, cloud security, loT security, information assurance, machine learning security, mobile/wireless security, network security, smart grid security, software/hardware security, supported by AFOSR, AFRL, EPSRC, NASA, NSA, NSF, NRL, ONR, ODNI, and industrial partners. UHM faculty have published 300+ papers in prestigious peer-reviewed journals and conferences, mentored security-focused graduate students, served as journal editors and reviewers, led research conferences, and given keynotes/invited talks at research conferences. These research successes earned UHM a CAE-R designation in May 2015. The designation provided many opportunities for Hawaiian communities including the establishment of the NSF CyberCorpsÂ® SFS program in 2016. UHM has enhanced computer science BA/BS degrees with a Security Science Concentration and a management MS degree with Information Security. UHM collaborated with local government, education institutions, and industry communities and founded CyberHawai'i in 2016, which broadens our outreach with high schools, community colleges, Hawai'i DOD, Hawai'i DOE, etc. Transfer Agreements (Articulation)*: Students who complete an Associates in Science Degree - Natural Science with a concentration in Engineering (ASNS Engineering) at Leeward CC, Kapiolani CC, may apply to transfer to the following program via a transfer agreement with the 4-year university programs listed below. There are other transfer options outside of these agreements. Contact a college counselor/advisor  for more information. subcontent.text: Chaminade University Computer Science | Hawaiâi Career Pathways Home Pathways & Programs Agriculture, Food, and Natural Resources Animal Systems (AS) Food Systems (FS) Agriculture and Food Production (AFP) Business Natural Resources Management (NRM) Building and Construction Mechanical, Electrical, and Plumbing (MEP) Systems Residential and Commercial Construction (RCC) Cultural Arts, Media, and Entertainment Digital Design (DD) Fashion and Artisan Design (FAD) Film and Media Production (FMP) Education Learning Support Professional (LSP) Teaching As a Profession (TAP) Health Services Public Health Services (PHS) Diagnostic Services (DS) Emergency Medical Services (EMS/EMT) Human Performance Therapeutic Services (HPTS) Nursing Services (NS) Hospitality, Tourism, and Recreation Culinary Arts (CA) Sustainable Hospitality and Tourism Management (SHTM) Information Technology and Digital Transformation Artificial Intelligence (AI) Programming Networking Cybersecurity (Cyber) Web Design and Development (WDD) Transportation Services Automotive Maintenance and Light Repair (MLR) Automotive Collision Repair (ACR) Aviation Maintenance Technology (AMT) Marine Maintenance Technology (MMT) Resources Contact Us BS Computer Science and Data Science, Analytics, & Visualization Home Networking Computer Science Program Description: We donât have to tell you how important computers are to everyday life. We use computers for communication, for learning, to have fun and to work. We use them for getting around town, getting around the country and for national security. Computers help us run airports, schools, hospitalsâeven our government. Itâs hard to imagine a world without themâand easy to see why computer science skills are in very high demand across just about every sector and just about everywhere. To prepare you for this ever-changing field, our Computer Science program is focused on hands-on learning so you can turn theory into practice and embrace critical thinking. We also believe in the power of social responsibility and so seek to inspire you to find ways to make a positive difference. Our innovative courses explore everything from software engineering to operating systems to computer architecture. And across our offerings, youâll have a strong network of support, including experienced faculty mentors and advisors who will help you map out your own academic path. The Data Science, Analytics and Visualization program is about preparing graduates for the data revolution that is occurring in every sector of the economy. Data Science is a fastest growing sector in computer science with millions of emerging jobs. Thatâs why we developed Hawaiiâs first B.S. Data Science Analytics and Visualization degree. An exceptional technical foundation is paired with an emphasis on data ethics and communication. Tailored programs allow you to specialize in business analytics, healthcare informatics, environmental analytics or S&T analytics. A graduate will be indispensable to a wide variety of employer organizations who need to leverage data to advance their missions. Your pre-graduation internships and real-world projects with big business, small business, agencies and community organizations will connect you to your future employers. Apply Now Contact Program Coordinator Dr. Rylan Chong Program Coordinator (808) 739-7445 rylan.chong@chaminade.edu Program Prerequisites: Admission to Chaminade University Competition of pre-program courses Cost and time commitment: Starting in Fall 2023, Chaminade Universityâs HawaiÊ»i Guarantee provides local high school graduates entering as freshmen the same tuition rate as University of Hawaiâi at Manoaâs annual resident undergraduate tuition AND an achievable pathway to graduate in four years. The program includes a combination of business, computer, and information technology courses. The program focuses on computers and information technology as tools to solve business problems. subcontent.text: Admission Requirements | Hawaiâi Career Pathways Home Pathways & Programs Agriculture, Food, and Natural Resources Animal Systems (AS) Food Systems (FS) Agriculture and Food Production (AFP) Business Natural Resources Management (NRM) Architectural Design and Engineering Technology Architectural Design (AD) Engineering Building and Construction Mechanical, Electrical, and Plumbing (MEP) Systems Residential and Commercial Construction (RCC) Cultural Arts, Media, and Entertainment Digital Design (DD) Fashion and Artisan Design (FAD) Film and Media Entertainment (FME) Education Learning Support Professional (LSP) Teaching As a Profession (TAP) Health Services Public Health Services (PHS) Diagnostic Services (DS) Emergency Medical Services (EMS/EMT) Human Performance Therapeutic Services (HPTS) Nursing Services (NS) Hospitality, Tourism, and Recreation Culinary Arts (CA) Sustainable Hospitality and Tourism Management (SHTM) Information Technology and Digital Transformation Artificial Intelligence (AI) Programming Networking Cybersecurity (Cyber) Web Design and Development (WDD) Transportation Services Automotive Maintenance and Light Repair (MLR) Automotive Collision Repair (ACR) Aviation Maintenance Technology (AMT) Marine Maintenance Technology (MMT) Resources Contact Us Admission Requirements Home Pathways & Programs Admission Requirements The  minimum admission requirements for the various colleges and universities in Hawaiâi are detailed below. You must meet the minimum admission requirement for each college or university to participate in any of their degree programs.  Additional prerequisite program requirements can be found on each programâs page on this site. * Universities have a selective admissions process and consider a number of factors in addition to the minimum admission requirements for acceptance. See links to each Universityâs admission page for more information. UH Community Colleges Be 18 years of age or older, or Have earned a U.S. high school diploma, GED, or equivalency certificate *Please see individual community college websites for course placement information * University of HawaiÊ»i at Manoa * University of HawaiÊ»i Hilo * University of HawaiÊ»i West Oahu Know and provide your current high school GPA Have taken the following high school course requirements: 4 units of English (*journalism and/or newswriting do not count as English credits) 3 units of Math (including Algebra I, Algebra II, and Geometry) 3 units of Science (laboratory courses recommended) 3 units of Social Studies 4 units of other college-prep courses at UHM/UHWO or 7 units of other college-prep courses at UH Hilo College-prep courses can include a 4th unit of math, science, or social science. High school foreign language courses count toward other college-prep courses, but is not required . Certain programs (e.g., nursing, social work, education, etc.) may have additional requirements. Please check with the appropriate department for more information. 5 units of electives (Examples of elective courses: Art, Dance, Band, Physical Education, AVID, Computer Science, etc.) If available, SAT or ACT scores (optional) Other supplemental documents (might be required for individual programs) Letter(s) of Recommendation Personal Statement & List of Achievements form * Chaminade University of Honolulu Cumulative high school GPA of 2.50 or higher High school students in dual enrollment or running start programs will need to submit official college transcripts Provide a written statement describing your interest in pursuing your degree at Chaminade University of Honolulu, and any related extracurricular activities that have prepared you for your educational goals.  This statement must be a minimum of 250 words. Test Scores (Optional) For Nursing program requirements GO HERE * HawaiÊ»i Pacific University HPU understands that each student has a unique academic history and individual talents. This is why HPU takes a holistic approach to reviewing applications, and considers all the information provided on your application to make an admissions decision.  For more admissions information, please visit the HPU Admissions website . This 60 credit program provides clear, explicit, coherent pathways for students intending to transfer into Science, Technology, Engineering and Mathematics (STEM) majors at baccalaureate institutions. The program provides curricula that focus on basic science and mathematics as well as more advanced research and mentoring experiences. The degree provides students with undergraduate research opportunities as they move through STEM curricular pathways. Targeted advising and appropriate course sequencing enable the efficient transfer of STEM students. Program Prerequisites: Placement into English 100 Composition I Placement into Math 103 College Algebra or higher University of Hawaii Community Colleges that offer ASNS - Engineering: Kapiâolani Community College Leeward Community College Windward Community College Honolulu Community College Kauaâi Community College UH Maui College Cost and time commitment: Cost per credit: $131 Total number of credits 60-66 Approximate total program tuition costs: $7,869-$8,646 Estimated program length: 2 years (based on 15-18 credits per semester) Financial Aid Resources Recommended College Courses during High School: The courses listed below are recommended for high school students to complete through a dual credit program such as Early College when in high school. title: Cyber Security | Hawaiâi Career Pathways
text: Cyber Security | Hawaiâi Career Pathways Home Pathways & Programs Agriculture, Food, and Natural Resources Animal Systems (AS) Food Systems (FS) Agriculture and Food Production (AFP) Business Natural Resources Management (NRM) Building and Construction Mechanical, Electrical, and Plumbing (MEP) Systems Residential and Commercial Construction (RCC) Cultural Arts, Media, and Entertainment Digital Design (DD) Fashion and Artisan Design (FAD) Film and Media Production (FMP) Education Learning Support Professional (LSP) Teaching As a Profession (TAP) Health Services Public Health Services (PHS) Diagnostic Services (DS) Emergency Medical Services (EMS/EMT) Human Performance Therapeutic Services (HPTS) Nursing Services (NS) Hospitality, Tourism, and Recreation Culinary Arts (CA) Sustainable Hospitality and Tourism Management (SHTM) Information Technology and Digital Transformation Artificial Intelligence (AI) Programming Networking Cybersecurity (Cyber) Web Design and Development (WDD) Transportation Services Automotive Maintenance and Light Repair (MLR) Automotive Collision Repair (ACR) Aviation Maintenance Technology (AMT) Marine Maintenance Technology (MMT) Resources Contact Us Cybersecurity Home Pathways and Programs IT Cybersecurity Cybersecurity Pathway Map to Employment Cybersecurity is the practice of protecting systems, networks, and programs from digital attacks.  The Cybersecurity programs in Hawaii will engage students in finding ways to safeguard our computer systems, networks and the data they hold by exposing students to the key facets of computer security and privacy that drive practice, research, and legislation. With these educational programs, students will be well prepared to continue developing their interests in security or privacy and be ready for the local job market in jobs such as Security Engineer, Security Consultant, or Computer Forensic Investigator.  The map below details the various educational pathways available in HawaiÊ»i from high school through college and into a career. The Breakdown of the Map Starting in a Cybersecurity program of study in high school, there are three general educational pathways available. Most careers in the IT industry require some postsecondary education or training; however, there are a number of entry level positions within the IT industry that a person can obtain with only a high school education. Community College Track (2+ Years) University Track (4+ Years) Training Programs (< 1-Year) How to use the map. Map Overview: The large map shows all the possible educational and training pathways available in Hawaii. You can click on any of the bubbles to obtain more information. Start Your Journey: If you prefer a guided approach, you can click on âStart Your Journeyâ in the upper left corner of the map. This will take you through various screens and include enlargements of the selected areas of the map overview. Admissions Requirement: As you navigate the map, be sure to read the admission requirements for the Community College and University Track Programs. You must meet admissions requirements to enroll in these programs. Bridging the Gap Students need to learn the right skills today to succeed in the jobs of tomorrow. subcontent.text: Leeward Community College Information & Computer Science | Hawaiâi Career Pathways Home Pathways & Programs Agriculture, Food, and Natural Resources Animal Systems (AS) Food Systems (FS) Agriculture and Food Production (AFP) Business Natural Resources Management (NRM) Building and Construction Mechanical, Electrical, and Plumbing (MEP) Systems Residential and Commercial Construction (RCC) Cultural Arts, Media, and Entertainment Digital Design (DD) Fashion and Artisan Design (FAD) Film and Media Production (FMP) Education Learning Support Professional (LSP) Teaching As a Profession (TAP) Health Services Public Health Services (PHS) Diagnostic Services (DS) Emergency Medical Services (EMS/EMT) Human Performance Therapeutic Services (HPTS) Nursing Services (NS) Hospitality, Tourism, and Recreation Culinary Arts (CA) Sustainable Hospitality and Tourism Management (SHTM) Information Technology and Digital Transformation Artificial Intelligence (AI) Programming Networking Cybersecurity (Cyber) Web Design and Development (WDD) Transportation Services Automotive Maintenance and Light Repair (MLR) Automotive Collision Repair (ACR) Aviation Maintenance Technology (AMT) Marine Maintenance Technology (MMT) Resources Contact Us Information & Computer Science Home Networking Information & Computer Science Program Description: The curriculum leading to an Associate in Science degree in Information and Computer Science is designed to prepare individuals for employment as technical assistants to professional and administrative personnel using computers. Students may choose one of five areas of specialty: Network Support Specialist, Information Security Specialist, Software Developer Specialist, Data Science Specialist, and Cloud Security Specialist. Skills in writing, speech, and mathematics complete the preparation for employment. In addition to training the student for work in the technical areas mentioned earlier, the program requirements are designed to facilitate transfer to the baccalaureate programs in Information and Computer Sciences at UH MÄnoa, UH Hilo, and UH West O'ahu for those students who wish to continue their education while working in the industry. Apply Now Contact Program Coordinator Michael Bauer Program Coordinator (808) 455-0310 mbauer@hawaii.edu Contact Program Counselor Amy Amper Program Counselor (808) 455-0235 amyamper@hawaii.edu Program Prerequisites: None Industry Related Credentials: Certain ICS  courses also help to prepare you to take the following industry certification exams: CompTIA A+ CompTIA Networking+ CompTIA Security+ CompTIA Linux+ CompTIA PenTest+ CISCO Certified Network Associate (CCNA) Certified Ethical Hacker (CEH) Cost and time commitment: Cost per credit: $131 Total number of credits 60 Approximate total program tuition costs: $7,869-$8,646 Estimated program length: 2 years (based on 15-18 credits per semester) Financial Aid Resources Recommended College Courses during High School: The courses listed below are recommended for high school students to complete through a dual credit program such as Early College when in high school. These courses meet degree requirements for the Leeward Community College program. General Academic Courses: ENG 100 Composition I *Prerequisite - Grade or credit in EN 22 or 24, OR Placement into ENG 100 Math 103 College Algebra *Prerequisite - Grade or credit in Math 82X, OR Placement into MATH 103 or higher. Program Specific Courses: ICS 101 Digital Tools for the Information World *Prerequisite - None ICS 111 Introduction to Computer Science *Prerequisite - ENG 22 or 24, Math 82X OR High STEM Math (check with campus for qualifying courses) *Prerequisites are courses or other background that must be completed PRIOR to enrollment. Prerequisites are REQUIRED for registration.  Please contact program coordinator or advisor for information on placement into courses as there are multiple methods of placement per campus. National Center for Academic Excellence in Cybersecurity (NCAE-C): Designation: CAE - Cyber Defense Education Sponsored by the National Security Agency (NSA), CAE-C designations are awarded to institutions that commit to producing cybersecurity professionals that will reduce vulnerabilities in our national infrastructure. Leeward Community College's Cybersecurity Center showcases a variety of cybersecurity related programs and resources available to students and faculty. The core Cyber Defense program at Leeward CC is in the Information and Computer Science program (ICS) , which provides students with a wide background in information and computer science including programming, networking, operating systems, and security fundamentals. Embedded in this program are Certificates of Achievement in Information Security, and Certificate of Competence in Information Security. These certificates are built on the Knowledge Unit (KU) requirements for a collegiate institution to be recognized as a CAE-CD. Transfer Agreements (Articulation)*: Students who complete the Associate of Science degree in ICS may apply to transfer to the following programs via a transfer agreement with the 4-year university programs listed below. subcontent.text: Kapiâolani Community College Information Technology Program | Hawaiâi Career Pathways Home Pathways & Programs Agriculture, Food, and Natural Resources Animal Systems (AS) Food Systems (FS) Agriculture and Food Production (AFP) Business Natural Resources Management (NRM) Building and Construction Mechanical, Electrical, and Plumbing (MEP) Systems Residential and Commercial Construction (RCC) Cultural Arts, Media, and Entertainment Digital Design (DD) Fashion and Artisan Design (FAD) Film and Media Production (FMP) Education Learning Support Professional (LSP) Teaching As a Profession (TAP) Health Services Public Health Services (PHS) Diagnostic Services (DS) Emergency Medical Services (EMS/EMT) Human Performance Therapeutic Services (HPTS) Nursing Services (NS) Hospitality, Tourism, and Recreation Culinary Arts (CA) Sustainable Hospitality and Tourism Management (SHTM) Information Technology and Digital Transformation Artificial Intelligence (AI) Programming Networking Cybersecurity (Cyber) Web Design and Development (WDD) Transportation Services Automotive Maintenance and Light Repair (MLR) Automotive Collision Repair (ACR) Aviation Maintenance Technology (AMT) Marine Maintenance Technology (MMT) Resources Contact Us Information Technology Program Home Networking Information Technology Program Description: The Information Technology program is career-laddered and competency-based. The program focuses on strong programming fundamentals, network connectivity, hands-on type projects, front-end graphical user interface (GUI) programming with strong connectivity to databases such as Microsoft ACCESS, Microsoft SQL Server, and Oracle in a stand alone as well as web environment. It provides training in the use and support of business-related computer systems, data communication networks (including local area networks), World Wide Web and its importance to businesses, and the development of business information technology systems programs using procedural and object-oriented programming techniques. The program includes a combination of business, computer, and information technology courses. Campus-based computer and networking projects, faculty-supervised laboratories, and workplace internships provide hands-on experience designed to prepare students for positions in computer support, programming, network hardware set up and configuration, or systems development in a business information technology system. The program focuses on computers, the Internet and the World Wide Web, and information technology as tools to solve business problems. The program trains students in the management of storage and the use of client-server environments in the accessing, processing, storing, and networking of information on computer-based business systems. Todayâs modern computing environment is a network of interrelated computer systems with connections via a local area network, wide area network, and the Internet. These computer-systems provide access to a variety of information to facilitate the operation of a business. The Information Technology program atKapiÊ»olani Community Collegeâs ensures student currency in these areas through courses in information technology. Apply Now Contact Program Coordinator David Stevens Program Coordinator (808) 734-9843 dsteven3@hawaii.edu Program Prerequisites: Placement into English 100 Placement into Math 103 Industry Related Credentials: Certain IT courses also help to prepare you to take the following industry certification exams: CompTIA A+ CompTIA Network+ CompTIA Security+ Cost and time commitment: Cost per credit: $131 Total number of credits 60-62 Approximate total program tuition costs: $7,869-$8,646 Estimated program length: 2 years (based on 15-18 credits per semester) Financial Aid Resources Recommended College Courses during High School: The courses listed below are recommended for high school students to complete through a dual credit program such as Early College when in high school. These courses meet degree requirements for the Kapiolani Community College IT  program. General Academic Courses: ENG 100 Composition I *Prerequisite - âCâ or better in ENG 22, OR placement into ENG 100 Math 103 College Algebra *Prerequisite - âCâ or better in MATH 82, OR placement into ENG 103 Program Specific Courses: ICS 101: Digital tools for the informational world *Prerequisite - Placement into ENG 100, AND Placement into MATH 103 ICS 111 Introduction to Computer Science *Prerequisite - Placement into MATH 135 or higher *Prerequisites are courses or other background that must be completed PRIOR to enrollment. Prerequisites are REQUIRED for registration.  Please contact program coordinator or advisor for information on placement into courses as there are multiple methods of placement per campus. National Center for Academic Excellence in Cybersecurity (NCAE-C): Designation: CAE - Cyber Defense Education Sponsored by the National Security Agency (NSA), CAE-C designations are awarded to institutions that commit to producing cybersecurity professionals that will reduce vulnerabilities in our national infrastructure. KapiÊ»olani Community College was named a National Center of Academic Excellence in Cyber Defense (CAE-CD) by the National Security Agency (NSA) and the Department of Homeland Security (DHS). The CAE-CD designation is awarded to regionally accredited academic institutions that offer high-quality cybersecurity-related degrees and certificates. The CAE-CD designation is based on a combination of elements related to the institution, focused on outputs for determining academic achievement. As a recognized institution, KapiÊ»olani CC has demonstrated that it engages in significant community involvement, embeds cybersecurity awareness in classes throughout the campus, encourages faculty professional development, integrates cybersecurity practices within the institution and prepares students to meet the growing need for professionals with cybersecurity skills. âThrough the guidance of the NSA and DHS to become a CAE-CD institution, our cybersecurity learning pathway incorporates real-life scenarios, critical-thinking and problem-solving exercises, hands-on labs, industry certificate preparation and cooperative decision-making activities, resulting in fully prepared cybersecurity professionals,â said KapiÊ»olani CC IT Director Dale Nakasone. âThe CAE designation will benefit graduates from KapiÊ»olani CC who will have the potential to become highly sought after as candidates for high-paying industry careers.â Transfer Agreements (Articulation)*: Students who complete the Associate of Science degree in IT may apply to transfer to the following programs via a transfer agreement with the 4-year university programs listed below. UH West Oahu - Bachelors of Applied Science in Information Technology ( Articulation Agreement - Fall 2019 ) Transfer agreements (also known as Articulation Agreements) are individual agreements between programs that facilitate a smooth transition from 2-year associate degree programs to 4-year bachelor degree programs. This technical cybersecurity degree program prepares students to meet the advanced cybersecurity workforce requirements of public sector agencies and private sector enterprises. This degree program supports both four-year students at UH West OÊ»ahu and pathway students from aligned Associate Degree programs from University of Hawaiâi Community Colleges. Check the program requirements for aligned courses. The Bachelor of Science in Cybersecurity offers a concentration in Cyber Operations. Prerequisites are REQUIRED for registration.  Please contact program coordinator or advisor for information on placement into courses as there are multiple methods of placement per campus. National Center for Academic Excellence in Cybersecurity (NCAE-C): Designation: CAE - Cyber Defense Education Sponsored by the National Security Agency (NSA), CAE-C designations are awarded to institutions that commit to producing cybersecurity professionals that will reduce vulnerabilities in our national infrastructure. Based on the rapid expansion of cyberspace operations and the importance of cybersecurity to both industry and the Asia-Pacific Region, the University of Hawai'i - West O'ahu (UHWO) developed the Bachelor of Applied Science degree with a concentration in Information Security and Assurance and Bachelor of Science in Cybersecurity . These degree programs are the first of their kind at a public institution in Hawai'i and the Pacific, developed in response to national and state needs for graduates with expertise in cybersecurity. The BAS - ISA program is designated as a National Center of Academic Excellence in Cyber Defense Education (CAE-CD), certified by the National Security Agency (NSA) and the Department of Homeland Security (DHS). With the support of the Office of Naval Research, UHWO established the UHWO Cyber Security Coordination Center (CSCC) in order to further promote Cyber Workforce Development. CSCC students research and analyze global and technical cyber events in order to coordinate with and support local and regional partners. The Cybersecurity programs are the premiere workforce development degree programs at UH West Oahu, which has been one of the fastest growing four-year baccalaureate public schools in the nation. You may find this degree of interest if you want to pursue software development as a career path or go to graduate school in computer science. In addition to the general track, the ICS Department also offers two specialized BS CS tracks: Data Science and Security Science. Prerequisites are REQUIRED for registration.  Please contact program coordinator or advisor for information on placement into courses as there are multiple methods of placement per campus. National Center for Academic Excellence in Cybersecurity (NCAE-C): Designation: CAE - Cyber Defense Research Sponsored by the National Security Agency (NSA), CAE-C designations are awarded to institutions that commit to producing cybersecurity professionals that will reduce vulnerabilities in our national infrastructure. The research of cybersecurity faculty at the University of HawaiÊ»i - Manoa (UHM) covers many critical issues, including cryptography, cloud security, loT security, information assurance, machine learning security, mobile/wireless security, network security, smart grid security, software/hardware security, supported by AFOSR, AFRL, EPSRC, NASA, NSA, NSF, NRL, ONR, ODNI, and industrial partners. UHM faculty have published 300+ papers in prestigious peer-reviewed journals and conferences, mentored security-focused graduate students, served as journal editors and reviewers, led research conferences, and given keynotes/invited talks at research conferences. These research successes earned UHM a CAE-R designation in May 2015. The designation provided many opportunities for Hawaiian communities including the establishment of the NSF CyberCorpsÂ® SFS program in 2016. UHM has enhanced computer science BA/BS degrees with a Security Science Concentration and a management MS degree with Information Security. UHM collaborated with local government, education institutions, and industry communities and founded CyberHawaiâi in 2016, which broadens our outreach with high schools, community colleges, Hawaiâi DOD, Hawaiâi DOE, etc. Jobs Hawaiâi Career Explorer Bridging the Gap Students need to learn the right skills today to succeed in the jobs of tomorrow. These degree programs are the first of their kind at a public institution in Hawai'i and the Pacific, developed in response to national and state needs for graduates with expertise in cybersecurity. The BAS - ISA program is designated as a National Center of Academic Excellence in Cyber Defense Education (CAE-CD), certified by the National Security Agency (NSA) and the Department of Homeland Security (DHS). With the support of the Office of Naval Research, UHWO established the UHWO Cyber Security Coordination Center (CSCC) in order to further promote Cyber Workforce Development. CSCC students research and analyze global and technical cyber events in order to coordinate with and support local and regional partners. The Cybersecurity programs are the premiere workforce development degree programs at UH West Oahu, which has been one of the fastest growing four-year baccalaureate public schools in the nation. Transfer Agreements (Articulation)*: Students who complete the Associate of Science degree from the UH Community College programs listed below may apply to transfer to UHWO BAS ISA via a transfer agreement listed below. Honolulu CC - AS Computer, Security & Networking Technology (CSNT) to UH West Oahu BAS-ISA Leeward CC - AS Information Computer Science (ICS) to UH West Oahu BAS-ISA Windward CC - ASNS Information & Communication Technology (ASNS ICT) to UH West Oahu BAS-ISA Transfer agreements (also known as Articulation Agreements) are individual agreements between programs that facilitate a smooth transition from 2-year associate degree programs to 4-year bachelor degree programs. subcontent.text: Honolulu Community College Computing, Security, and Networking Technology Program | Hawaiâi Career Pathways Home Pathways & Programs Agriculture, Food, and Natural Resources Animal Systems (AS) Food Systems (FS) Agriculture and Food Production (AFP) Business Natural Resources Management (NRM) Building and Construction Mechanical, Electrical, and Plumbing (MEP) Systems Residential and Commercial Construction (RCC) Cultural Arts, Media, and Entertainment Digital Design (DD) Fashion and Artisan Design (FAD) Film and Media Production (FMP) Education Learning Support Professional (LSP) Teaching As a Profession (TAP) Health Services Public Health Services (PHS) Diagnostic Services (DS) Emergency Medical Services (EMS/EMT) Human Performance Therapeutic Services (HPTS) Nursing Services (NS) Hospitality, Tourism, and Recreation Culinary Arts (CA) Sustainable Hospitality and Tourism Management (SHTM) Information Technology and Digital Transformation Artificial Intelligence (AI) Programming Networking Cybersecurity (Cyber) Web Design and Development (WDD) Transportation Services Automotive Maintenance and Light Repair (MLR) Automotive Collision Repair (ACR) Aviation Maintenance Technology (AMT) Marine Maintenance Technology (MMT) Resources Contact Us Computing, Security, and Networking Technology Program Home Networking CSNT Program Description: The Associate in Science (AS) Degree in the Computing, Security, and Networking Technology (CSNT) program is a two-year course of study that will prepare you for entry-level employment in the field of Information and Communications Technology. Core courses are designed to give you a firm foundation in the basics of computers, networking, system administration and information security. The AS Degree also provides options for a Certificate of Achievement in Networking and Telecommunications and a Certificate of Achievement in Information Assurance. Apply Now Contact Program Coordinator Sally Dunan Program Coordinator (808) 844-2352 sdunan@hawaii.edu Program Prerequisites: Placement into English 100 Composition I Placement into Math 103 College Algebra or higher Recommended: ICS 100 Computer Literacy & Applications or ICS 101 Digital Tools for the Information World Industry Related Credentials: Certain CSNT courses also help to prepare you to take the following industry certification exams CompTIA A+ CISCO Certified Network Associate (CCNA) Microsoft Certified Professional CompTIA Security+ CompTIA Linux+ VMware Certified Professional LPI Linux Essentials Program Notes: The CSNT program is a Cisco Academy, a CompTIA Training Center, a Microsoft Regional Academy, and a VMware Academy. Majority of CSNT classes are offered in-person at the Honolulu CC campus Cost and time commitment: Cost per credit: $131 Total number of credits 60-63 Approximate total program tuition costs: $7,869-$8,253 Estimated program length: 2 years (based on 15-18 credits per semester) Financial Aid Resources Recommended College Courses during High School: The courses listed below are recommended for high school students to complete through a dual credit program such as Early College when in high school. These courses meet degree requirements for the Honolulu Community College CSNT program. General Academic Courses: ENG 100 Composition I *Prerequisite - âCâ or better in ESL 23, OR Placement into ENG 100 Math 103 College Algebra *Prerequisite - âCâ or better in MATH 25, OR Placement into MATH 103 or higher. Program Specific Courses: CSNT 110 Introduction to Information Systems (Crosslisted as ICS 110P) *Prerequisite - ENG 100, AND Placement into MATH 103 or higher, AND ICS 100 or ICS 101 ICS 111 Introduction to Computer Science *Prerequisite - MATH 103, OR Placement into MATH 135 or higher Networking Pathway: Offered at HonCC only CSNT 132 ICT Support *Prerequisite - ENG 100, AND Placement into MATH 103 or higher, AND ICS 100 or ICS 101 CSNT 140 Computer Networking *Prerequisite - CSNT 132 ICT Support *Prerequisites are courses or other background that must be completed PRIOR to enrollment. Prerequisites are REQUIRED for registration.  Please contact program coordinator or advisor for information on placement into courses as there are multiple methods of placement per campus. National Center for Academic Excellence in Cybersecurity (NCAE-C): Designation: CAE - Cyber Defense Education (VALIDATION for CSNT program only) Sponsored by the National Security Agency (NSA), CAE-C designations are awarded to institutions that commit to producing cybersecurity professionals that will reduce vulnerabilities in our national infrastructure. In 2013, Honolulu Community College was awarded the designation Cyber Defense Education. While the campus wide designation has not been renewed, the National Security Agency (NSA) and a committee of academic peers has validated the Associate of Science in Computing, Security, and Networking Technology program of study as meeting the nationally established criteria for Cyber Defense education through academic year 2027. Transfer Agreements (Articulation)*: Students who complete the Associate of Science degree in CSNT may apply to transfer to the following programs via a transfer agreement with the 4-year university programs listed below. There are other transfer options outside of these agreements. Contact a college counselor/advisor  for more information. You must meet the minimum admission requirement for each college or university to participate in any of their degree programs.  Additional prerequisite program requirements can be found on each programâs page on this site. * Universities have a selective admissions process and consider a number of factors in addition to the minimum admission requirements for acceptance. UH Community Colleges Be 18 years of age or older, or Have earned a U.S. high school diploma, GED, or equivalency certificate *Please see individual community college websites for course placement information * University of HawaiÊ»i at Manoa * University of HawaiÊ»i Hilo * University of HawaiÊ»i West Oahu Know and provide your current high school GPA Have taken the following high school course requirements: 4 units of English (*journalism and/or newswriting do not count as English credits) 3 units of Math (including Algebra I, Algebra II, and Geometry) 3 units of Science (laboratory courses recommended) 3 units of Social Studies 4 units of other college-prep courses at UHM/UHWO or 7 units of other college-prep courses at UH Hilo College-prep courses can include a 4th unit of math, science, or social science. High school foreign language courses count toward other college-prep courses, but is not required . Certain programs (e.g., nursing, social work, education, etc.) may have additional requirements. This statement must be a minimum of 250 words. title: Web Design and Development | Hawaiâi Career Pathways
text: Web Design and Development | Hawaiâi Career Pathways Home Pathways & Programs Agriculture, Food, and Natural Resources Animal Systems (AS) Food Systems (FS) Agriculture and Food Production (AFP) Business Natural Resources Management (NRM) Building and Construction Mechanical, Electrical, and Plumbing (MEP) Systems Residential and Commercial Construction (RCC) Cultural Arts, Media, and Entertainment Digital Design (DD) Fashion and Artisan Design (FAD) Film and Media Production (FMP) Education Learning Support Professional (LSP) Teaching As a Profession (TAP) Health Services Public Health Services (PHS) Diagnostic Services (DS) Emergency Medical Services (EMS/EMT) Human Performance Therapeutic Services (HPTS) Nursing Services (NS) Hospitality, Tourism, and Recreation Culinary Arts (CA) Sustainable Hospitality and Tourism Management (SHTM) Information Technology and Digital Transformation Artificial Intelligence (AI) Programming Networking Cybersecurity (Cyber) Web Design and Development (WDD) Transportation Services Automotive Maintenance and Light Repair (MLR) Automotive Collision Repair (ACR) Aviation Maintenance Technology (AMT) Marine Maintenance Technology (MMT) Resources Contact Us Web Design and Development Home Pathways and Programs IT Web Design and Development Web Design and Development Map to Employment Web design and development describes the process of creating a website.  Web design determines the look and feel of a website, while web development determines how it functions. Web Design refers to the process of designing the visual layout and user interface of a website. It includes creating a website's graphics, typography, color schemes, and overall look and feel. Web designers may use various software tools and techniques, such as wireframing, prototyping, and mockups, to create website designs that are functional and aesthetically pleasing. Web development is acheived through students learning to use different programming languages, like HTML, PHP, and Java, to develop a websiteâs core functionality.  Functionality might be things like what happens when someone clicks a button or how the main navigation loads when a user scrolls or clicks on it. The Web Design & Development programs in HawaiÊ»i will engage students in the design process, coding, problem solving and validation as well as content development and analysis.  Through the educational programs in HawaiÊ»i, students can pursue careers in web design and development such as Web Devloper, Graphic Web Designer, adn Full Stack Developer.  The map below details the various educational pathways available in HawaiÊ»i from high school through college and into a career. The Breakdown of the Map Starting in a Web Design & Development program of study in high school, there are three general educational pathways available. Most careers in the IT industry require some postsecondary education or training; however, there are a number of entry level positions within the IT industry that a person can obtain with only a high school education. Community College Track (2+ Years) University Track (4+ Years) Training Programs (< 1-Year) How to use the map. Map Overview: The large map shows all the possible educational and training pathways available in Hawaii. You can click on any of the bubbles to obtain more information. Start Your Journey: If you prefer a guided approach, you can click on âStart Your Journeyâ in the upper left corner of the map. This will take you through various screens and include enlargements of the selected areas of the map overview. Admissions Requirement: As you navigate the map, be sure to read the admission requirements for the Community College and University Track Programs. You must meet admissions requirements to enroll in these programs. Bridging the Gap Students need to learn the right skills today to succeed in the jobs of tomorrow. If you are a computer science major, you will see this in many formsâthe study of algorithms, of machine hardware, of programming languages, operating systems, database design, and more. The career opportunities are equally variedâsoftware engineer, database manager, network administrator, project manager, and many others. The U. S. Bureau of Labor Statistics, part of the U.S. Department of Labor, predicts that for 2006â2016, three of the six occupations that will be among the fastest growing and register the largest numerical growth will be computing related occupations. Computer Science at UH Hilo offers you small class sizes, very available faculty who take a great interest in student success, opportunities for team experiences, and a strong sense of community among the upper-division students. Students in this program generally score above the national average on the Major Field Achievement Test in Computer Science, and graduates are employed by major companies in HawaiÊ»i and on the mainland. Apply Now Contact Program Chair Michael âMikeâ R.
